loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti K. is 36 years old and married. She sells fried snacks by going around the village everyday. She has to work to supplement her family's income since her husband Mustakim has no fixed income. She usually earns $8.50 per day and it is not enough for her family needs. She asks for an IDR 500,000 loan to complete her business, and hopes that this will improve her everyday income. Siti is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Sumiyati

texts.en: Sumiyati is a 29 years old and is married. She sells sheets on credit and goes door to door to sell her products. She usually earns an income of $16.5 per week. Her husband Ujang is a driver and usually earns $3 per day. She needs more capital to expand her business. Sumiyati is a member of MBK and requests an IDR 500,000 loan. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maryanah

texts.en: Maryanah is 45 years old and is married with two children ages 19 and five. She sells some foods such as noodles, fried snacks, etc., and usually earns $2.50 - $3.50 per day. Her husband Toni is in the Army and usually sends her $7 per week. Maryanah is a member of MBK and needs an IDR 500,000 loan to buy more goods and pay for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: M.teko Group

texts.ru:
Munira O., 32, is the leader of this group of borrowers. She is a mother of 2 children. She purchases her goods twice a month. Munira asks for 600 somoni [1 somoni is about $0.41] loan for 4 months. Naim, 21, owns a small food store. Naim purchases the products and brings them to the store where his worker sells them. Naim asks for 1600 loan for 6 months. Mahbuba, 22, gradually bought out all the equipment (phones and computers) in a telephone center, where she worked. Now she is an independent entrepreneur. Mahbuba owns 2 long-distance phone service centers. She plans to repay her portion of the loan within 6 months. Umeda A., 20, sells pre-paid SIM cards for mobile phones. She has been in business for 4 years. She asks for 1600 somoni for 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Очилова Мунира имеет среднее образование ей 32 года. Мать 2 детей. За товаром она ездит 2 раза в месяц за город. Она просит 600 сомони на 4 месяца. Наиму 21 год он имеет небольшой магазин, он привозит продукты питания, где его работник продает товар. Его займ составляет 1600 сомони со сроком 6 месяцев. Махбубе 22 года 4 года назад была в качестве работника в переговорном пункте. Со временм она выкупила все оборудования (телефоны и компьютер) сейчас она уже самостоятельный предпрениматель , у нее есть 2 самостоятельные точки по переговорному пункту, междугородной связи. Она собирается погасить свой займ в течении пол года. Алиева Умеда возраст- 20 лет , уроженка Б Гафуровского района, она перепродает карточки мобильных телефонов. Она занимается этим делом уже 4 года. Она получила 1600 сомони на 6 месяцев.

loans.use: To purchase clothing, food products, and pre-paid SIM cards for mobile phones

loans.name: Yuyun

texts.en: Yuyun is 39 years old and is married with four children. She is a tailor along with her husband. She usually earns a small income and it's just enough for their daily needs. During summertime, her potential profits increase with the season. Yuyun requests IDR 500,000 to expand her business and this will provide income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months

loans.use: Expand her business and this will provide income for her children's education.

loans.name: Mehriban

texts.en: Mehriban A. is a mother of four children. This 58-year-old woman is a widow. She lives in the Salyan region, in Yenikand village.  She has been in the farming business for 20 years. Now she is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Rati

texts.en: Rati is 35 years old and is married with three children, all whom are girls. She sells snacks, cooking oil, eggs, and noodles and usually earns $10 per day. Her husband Asim is a driver with a small salary. She asks for a IDR 500,000 loan to complete her shop and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Complete her shop

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en: Yanti is 30 years old and is married. She sells snacks and blended ice, and usually earns $5.50 - $6.50 per day. Her husband Firdaus is selling noodles in Jakarta, earning $10 per week. Yanti would like a loan of IDR 500,000 to buy more goods and increase the income for her children's education. She's a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Identity

texts.en: The entrepreneur is 33 years old. He is married and has two children. His mother moved in with him after his father died. He has a small computer shop in Kirkuk. He applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new internet system to share out internet lines with houses and shops near to his shop. He also wants to renovate the shop to increase his income and develop his business. He wants to save for a better life for his family.

loans.use: Purchase a new internet system

loans.name: Yayah

texts.en: Yayah H. is 22 years old and is married with one child, age three. She sells sheets and clothes on credit and usually earns $5 per day. Yayah requests a IDR 500,000 loan to complete her business, which will earn more income for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Mulyati

texts.en: Mulyati is a 43 years old and is married with four children ages 29, 20, 17, and 11. She is the sole provider for her daily needs and her children's education. She sells clothes on credit and by going around from place to place to meet customers. In this way, Mulyati earns $33 per week. She is a member of MBK and asks for a IDR 500,000 loan to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her clothes selling business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.en: Gulmira I. is 44 years old, lives in the Khaladj village in the Salyan region, and has a daughter (shown in the picture). Gulmira has run her own farming business for 10 years. Now she needs a loan of $1200 to buy a plot of land to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Yanah

texts.en: Yanah is 32 years old and is married. She manages goat livestock. She buys baby goats and then raises them until they become bigger. Her husband Kamil is a laborer and usually earns $10 per week. She is a member of MBK and needs a loan to expand her business. She hopes it will help  finance her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nahida

texts.en: Nahida S. is 27 years old and single (her mother is pictured). She has run her own business for 5 years now. She wants to improve the yield of her farming endeavor, and has requested a loan or $1200 to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Abdul Khaliq

texts.en:
Abdul Khaliq lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with one son, and he lives with his own family.

He has a car parts shop. He has a lot of experience in his job. He was in this business for more than 5 years in Pakistan. When he came back, he started working in Kabul. Now he wants to expand his business in Afghanistan, so he requested an individual loan to increase his stock. He wants to make a good income to make a better life for his family. He is happy, and he would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Azad

texts.en: Azad R. is 32 years old, divorced and doesn't have any children. He lives in the Yenikand village of the Salyan region. Azad has five years of experience in the farming business, and has requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Gulara

texts.en: Gulara Mavafova started in the farming business 10 years ago. She is a 48-year-old mother of three children and lives in the Salyan region, in Yenikand village. Now she requesting a loan to buy pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizer

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mahbob

texts.en: Mahbob lives in district 10 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is a young and talented boy with a car repair shop. He has a lot of experience in his job, as he started this business when he was 9 years old. He has a big shop with lots of materials. He wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines and complete his stock. He wants to make a better future for his family and also for himself. He is happy now.

loans.use: To buy new machines and complete his stock

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Salma M. is a 67-year-old mother of six who lives in Vituka in Dar Es Salaam city. She runs a grocery in the area, a business that she has been doing for the past thirty years. She is in need of $575 to help expand and sustain her business.

loans.use: Expand grocery business

loans.name: Mwajuma

texts.en: Mwajuma M., 35, is a mother of four. She is lives in the Mbagala area, one of Dar Es Salaam's biggest slums. She sells fresh vegetables at a market close to her home. Mwajuma wakes very early in the morning to go for the stock, which she either buys at Kariakoo Dar’s biggest trading area or gets from the suppliers from the near-by growing areas. She is in need of $350 to help expand her business.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Kwintini

texts.en: Kwintini B. is a 38-year-old father of two who lives in the Lumo area of Dar Es Salaam city. He has been in business for the past 16 years selling building and construction materials. He runs his hardware shop in an up-and-coming area where most residents are constructing permanent residential houses. He is in need of $350 to help expand his business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman I. is a 37-year-old widower who has one child. He lives in the Salyan region, in Khaladj village. He has 8 years of experience in farming, and needs a loan of $1200 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Komak Credit Union - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mwasiti

texts.en: Mwasiti H. is a 37-year-old resident  of the Lumo area in Dar Es Salaam. She owns a shop selling food and household utensils. Mwasiti has been running the shop for the past three years, and dreams of turning her retail shop into a wholesale shop. To help expand, she needs a loan of $325.

loans.use: Expand Business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma I. F. is a 32-year-old mother of three and a resident of the Lumo area of Dar es Salaam. She runs a retail shop selling food items and household utensils. She has been doing this business for the past seven years, and now wants to expand her shop into a bigger supplies shop. Fatuma is in need of $325 to help expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Teymur

texts.en: Teymur M. is 28 years old and single. He lives in the Salyan region, in Khaladj village. He has four years of experience in farming. Teymur needs a loan of $1200 to purchase fertilizer and pesticides to increase his yield.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build an additional room for my home.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 43 years old and has five children. She chose taxi-driving as her business because she believes it is a way to earn money fast. Her loan will be used to buy very expensive parts, such as tires. Her husband drives the taxi 6 days a week, during the daytime. She makes 100 Tala ($40 US) of net income per day and she continues to operate her business because of the financial support it has provided her family. It has especially helped with her children’s school fees. She hopes that her next loan will be used to repair her home, which is damaged, and replace parts for the taxi. She really appreciates the help she has received from the loan program and hopes to remain with the program for a long time.

loans.use: To buy auto parts for her taxi

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah T. is a strong lady of thirty eight years of age, married with three children. She is very interested in maintaining and growing her plantation business by weeding and planting. Her loan is to be used for buying weed-killing chemicals, fertilizers, knives, a spade and an ax. She sells her crops at the market 3 days per week, and gets 220 Tala ($88 US) per day. If it is a very busy day, such as White Sunday or Christmas, she can make up to 350 Tala ($140). She thinks that her next loan will be used to pay for the next year’s tuition for her daughter at the national university.  Her business is going well, and she is very happy and thankful for the loan program.

loans.use: To buy tools for her plantation

loans.name: Lole

texts.en: Lole is a 35-year-old businesswoman with five kids. She’s been operating her business for about four years, but she just joined SPBD’s loan program last year. Her $300USD loan was all used to buy inventory for the shop consisting of mostly junk foods, freezer foods and daily need items. Her shop is open seven days per week and she earns 230 Tala ($92 US) net profit per day. She said that  her business helps meet the family's daily needs as well as helping with her children's school tuition.. She has to work very hard in her business since it is the only source of income she is getting now. She wishes to receive another loan to extend the room she sells her stock and add additional stock .  The loan program is the only financial support she has.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Kirudis Altagracia

texts.en:
Kirudis, 41, is one of the most successful businesswomen of Guanuma.   You just have to visit her grocery store in the morning to realize it’s well frequented by the people of the community.  She says it’s a challenge  to keep the store well stocked because of the demand for her products.

Generally, the products she sells are delivered directly to her store.  But she goes to the capital to buy products that are very expensive to stock locally. For example, a pack of disposable diapers costs about USD 13.00 in Guanuma but only USD 10.00 in Santo Domingo.  Because she stocks large quantities of those goods, it’s better to buy them in the capital. The best selling items are plantains, bananas, manioc, cabbage, carrots, eggplants, rice, and other basic foodstuffs. 

Kirudis supplements the household income with her profits. In this way, Kirudis and her husband (a lieutenant of the National Police) make ends meet and take care of their seven children.

Some products that Kirudis sells daily are in short supply.  She needs funds to acquire some beans, rice, potatoes, oil, rum, and other alcoholic and energy drinks.  That loan will allow Kirudis to continue meeting the day-to-day needs of her customers and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as rice, vegetables, and drinks for her grocery store.

loans.name: Piedad De Jesús

texts.en:
Piedad, 35, lives with her husband and their two boys.  Her husband, a professional painter, works in Santo Domingo, the capital.  Five months ago, Piedad took out a loan and used it to open a small cosmetics business. She sells lip gloss, lipstick, skincare products, hair lotion, perfumes, and women’s fragrances. Because she managed her small business prudently, she was able to pay back the loan before the due date.  

She runs her business from home, but sometimes she sells door to door or in the public market, especially on weekends.

Now she wants to expand the business and introduce gold-filled and silver jewelry to diversify her inventory and attract more customers.  She has applied for a second loan for this purpose.  The entrepreneur hopes that very soon her business will grow and that she’ll have her own location from which to run the store.

loans.use: To buy gold-filled and silver jewelry to sell from her business.

loans.name: Piedad De Jesús

texts.en:
Piedad, 35 years old, is living with her husband and their two boys.  Her husband is a professional painter and is working in Santo Domingo, the capital.  Five months ago, Piedad took a loan from our organization and with it she opened a small cosmetics store. She sells lip color, lipstick, skincare products, hair lotion treatment and perfumes and women’s fragrances. As she had handled prudently her small business, she could pay back the loan before the due date.  

She runs her business within her house, even though sometimes she leaves her house to sell in the streets or the public place, especially on the week-ends.

Now she wants to enlarge the store and introduce gold-filled and silver jewelry so as to diversify her inventory and attract more people.  She has applied for a second loan that will allow her reach these goals.  The entrepreneur nourishes the hope that very soon her business will gain importance and that she’ll have her own local where she can operate the store.

loans.use: To buy gold-filled jewels and introduce silvered jewelry to her business.

loans.name: Altagracia Severino

texts.en:
Altagracia, 42, is a single mother of six children (3 girls and 3 boys).   Her children attend public school, except the two youngest, who are only four and two.

She didn't earn enough money working as cleaning woman to make ends meet, and she was obliged to find a way to earn more money so that she could take care of her large family.  

She took out a loan, which she repaid even before the due date.  She used the loan to buy beauty products to resell in her community.  She sells hand and body lotions, beauty soaps, hair treatments, and so forth.  She runs the business from home and has a lot of loyal customers.  Her monthly profit is USD 75.

Altagracia thinks that getting a new loan will be a huge opportunity to expand the business.  She plans to purchase the same products she currently sells, but in bulk.  That way, she’ll increase her sales margins and improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Juanita Bello

texts.en:
Juanita is a very likeable, charming, and intelligent person.  She’s got a terrific sense of humor.  Her constantly smiling face makes her look younger than her 46 years.  She has ten children.  The two eldest live in Santo Domingo, the capital. Her husband is a self-employed radio technician.

Juana runs a ‘ventorillo’ ( a small business stand) that she opened six months ago with a loan she took from our organization.  That business has been very successful, and she makes a daily profit of about USD 15.00.

Now, Juana is thinking about making additional money.  She needs funds to purchase more inventory and in this way increase sales.  She would use part of the loan to buy clothes that she’ll sell from home, with the help of one of her daughters.  In this way, she hopes to expand and diversify her business so that she can take good care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and clothing for resale

loans.name: Irene Gálvez

texts.en:
Irene is fond of saying that “the responsibility drives the will.” She believes that where there's a will there's a way. She says that no matter what happens in your life, if you have your dreams as motivation you’ll succeed in life.

She is 25 years old, and has two handsome and loved boys (five and four years old). Her husband is a lieutenant. Irene has always dreamt of graduating from a good university and working in a profession. However, after her first pregnancy, she had to stay in home to take care of her baby. Shortly after, she had her second son, and she had to find a job or do something to help her husband with the household expenses.

She obtained a loan from our organization and started to sell natural medicines by catalog. She also sells natural hair care and skin care products in addition to natural remedies. Her business is very profitable. Her sales volume has gone up during the last two months, and now she makes a weekly profit of USD 50.00. Irene has requested a new loan to acquire more products in order to increase her sales volume. She says that additional money will help her continue her university studies, dropped a long time ago. The entrepreneur has a very positive attitude and thinks that she will have the opportunity to reach her goals and prove that it’s never late to succeed in life.

loans.use: To buy natural medicines for resale

loans.name: Timotea De Los Santo

texts.en:
Timotea is 27 years old and has five children (two boys and three girls). The three eldest attend the local public school. Her husband sells fish.

Timotea has been selling cosmetics for more than six years. She runs the business from home and has many loyal customers. She purchases the goods at Villa Consuelo in Santo Domingo, a well-known supplier of quality goods at reasonable prices.

Timotea has applied for a loan to expand her business. She wants to purchase fingernail polish, hair lotion, shampoo, skin lotion, perfumes, lipstick, makeup, and other cosmetics in bulk. She thinks that Christmas is a very good time to increase sales volume and get new clients. With the loan, she will buy cosmetics and offer them for sale at very attractive prices. In this way, she hopes that many people will get hear about her business and possibly become her customers. Additional income will help her improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To buy big cosmetics in bulk to sell during the Christmas season

loans.name: Malelega

texts.en: Malelega is an active lady of twenty five years of age with two kids now. She applies for a $300USD loan which will be used to buy all the ingredients needed for her business. She sells her pancakes with the coffee at the market mostly in the morning time where most of the workers are there for their morning tea. She earns 180 Tala ($72 US) profit per day and works five days per week. She hopes that her next loan will be used to open her new fast foods stall business at the flea market where she plans to cater foods to the public who are on their way around town. She likes the loan program and hopes to stay long in it.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pancakes/coffee business

loans.name: Olimapeta Leilani

texts.en: She is a young lady of twenty two years of age married with  one daughter. She just finished school and is staying home to look after her baby.  She thinks that it is better for her to develop a small business at home to not only use her time but to earn money to help support her family. She applies for the amount of $300USD and will use the money to buy all the ingredients needed for the business, such as the flour, dripping and a new big frying pan. She recently started her business and it is going well but hopes that it will be much better in the future. She thinks that her next loan will be used to improve it and think of another business to compliment it.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her pancake

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
Gerardo is a man who has struggled to get ahead. For several years he worked in the U.S., where he has residency. Unfortunately, the small business that he had built with his brother did not succeed and had to be sold to the competition. He returned to Mexico where, in order to generate income, he started to build furniture such as entertainment centers, dining room furniture and other small pieces that nearby residents order from him.

Gerardo is asking for a loan of $475USD, to be repaid over a period of six months. He would like to be able to purchase wood/other furniture that he can offer for sale during the fast-approaching holiday season – a time when there is higher demand for his products to give as gifts. With your help, Gerardo and his family can overcome the previous difficulties that forced them to return to their country and to succeed there.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Gerardo, es un hombre que a luchado por salir adelante, hace varios años, trabajó en EUA, puesto que tiene residencia, sin embargo la pequeña empresa que había fabricado junto con su hermano quebró y se la tuvieron que vender a la competencia, así fue como regresó a México, en donde para salir adelante, comenzó por vender muebles, sobre pedido y a fabricarlos, tales como comedores, centros de entretenimiento, en sí muebles pequeños que las personas a su alrededor le solicitan.

Debido a que la temporada Navideña está por comenzar, Gerardo, está solicitando un crédito de US $475 que está dispuesto a pagar en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Gerardo podrá comprar madera y muebles para venderlos, puesto que en esta temporada es cuándo más compran muebles como regalos de navidad. Con tu ayuda Gerardo y su familia podrá superar el fracaso que los hizo regresar a su país y salir adelante en México.

loans.use: Purchase wood/furniture for carpentry business.

loans.name: Asenati

texts.en: Asenati is married and the mother of seven children. She is working very hard selling eggs, drinks, and popcorn all around town and the village too, because this is the only source of income she’s getting now. She walks around the town area six days a week and she rests on Sunday. She earns almost $95ST net profit per day. She wishes to apply for her second loan in order to start a fast foods stall at the market, because she’s tired of walking around every day. Thanks to help from this program she is comfortable raising  her family, especially her children.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her food vending business

loans.name: Petra

texts.es:
Petra began her business of selling natural products due to the fact that her and her partner’s earnings did not cover their living expenses. With the help of a friend, she started selling her products from her house to supplement her family’s income. She later was able to independently run her business from a separate, rented, location. Little by little, and with much effort, her business has grown and tries to offer only the best of products to maintain a satisfied customer base.

Despite this, with the changing season, it becomes more difficult for her to supply her business with products purchased mostly during winter -- such as cold formulas. Petra asks for a loan of $625USD which she plans to repay over a six month period. She would like to use these funds to increase the inventory of products she offers for sale, thus continuing the growth of her enterprise and helping her to pay for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Petra inicio el negocio de venta de productos naturales, puesto que con lo que ganaba ella y su pareja no les alcanzaba para los gastos del hogar y de sus hijos. Y debido a esta necesidad inició el negocio de venta por catalogo de productos naturales en su casa, ayudándole a su amiga, posteriormente se independizo e inicio su propio negocio rentando un local para ofrecer sus productos. Poco a poco y con mucho esfuerzo ha ido creciendo el negocio tratando de ofrecer siempre mejores productos para que sus clientes queden satisfechos.

Sin embargo con el cambio de temporada, le es difícil a Petra surtir su negocio de productos que compran más en invierno, como las fórmulas antigripales. Por lo tanto Petra está solicitando un crédito de US $625 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Petra podrá surtir su negocio, para que éste siga creciendo, y continuar con los estudios de sus hijos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Since childhood Ricardo dreamed of becoming a famous singer, and has loved music, singing, dancing and playing music instruments. After finishing his studies, he decided to make his dream a reality so he began playing at parties in Monterrey. Over time, he married and moved to Reynosa. There, with the encouragement of his wife, he continued to perform despite having few instruments to play.

Ricardo would like to grow his business and purchase more music instruments to offer a better service to his customers. He asks for a loan of $625USD to be repaid over a period of six months. With this loan, he plans to expand his business and continue his dream. He has faith that he can succeed with your help.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ricardo desde niño le gusto mucho la música, el cantar, tocar instrumentos musicales, bailar siempre mantuvo el sueño de ser un cantante famoso. Después que termino sus estudios de Técnico, decidió realizar sus sueños, empezó a cantar y tocar en fiestas en Monterrey N. L. Con el paso del tiempo se casó y se traslado a Reynosa, en donde siguió con su sueño de cantar, e impulsado por su esposa lo ha realizado, y así con los pocos instrumentos con los que cuenta a salido a tocar a fiestas.

Sin embargo, Ricardo necesita crecer su negocio y comprar instrumentos para poder ofrecerle un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por lo tanto está solicitando un préstamo de US $625 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con ese dinero poder comprar más instrumentos y así poder dar mas proyección, servicio y empuje a su sueño, Ricardo tiene la fe de que lo podrá obtener gracias a tu ayuda.

loans.use: Purchase music instruments.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
Reyna has seven married children, and one child who is still single and living at home. When the children were young, the family lived on her husband’s earnings. Now that most of the children are married, her husband no longer works. They rely on a small pension that he receives which is not enough to cover their living expenses. Reyna therefore decided to start selling plastic products and now, between her neighbors and other acquaintances, she has a good customer base. Because she was often asked about clothing, she began selling apparel as well.

Unfortunately, she receives numerous orders that she cannot fill since she relies on any earnings she makes for living expenses. She is asking for a loan of $675USD, to be repaid over a six month period, to purchase more merchandise such as clothing and other items that her customers request. With your help we can improve Reyna and her husband’s standard of living, despite their not having stable work.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Reyna, es una mujer que tiene ya 7 hijos casados y uno soltero, quien vive todavía con ella. Desde que estaban chicos sus hijos la familia vivió de lo que ganaba el esposo, sin embargo ahora que todos sus hijos están casados, el esposo ya no trabaja y el único sueldo que reciben es el de la pensión con la que quedó, sin embargo con esta no les alcanza para vivir, por lo que Reyna se decidió a vender artículos de plástico, entre sus vecinos y conocidos, hoy ya tiene más clientela que poco a poco le hace pedidos, y la gente después fue preguntándole por ropa y hoy maneja las dos cosas.

Sin embargo hoy tiene varios pedidos que ella no puede surtir, puesto que vive al día con lo que gana, y está solicitando un crédito de US $675 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y así poder comprar mercancía como ropa de la temporada y artículos que ya le solicitaron. Con tu ayuda, lograrás que Reyna y su Esposo, tengan una manera de superarse y salir adelante a pesar de no tener un empleo estable.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to sell over the holiday season.

loans.name: Leuatea

texts.en: Leuatea is a mother of four kids, who are living together in one house. She applied for the750 Tala ($300USD) loan amount and used the money to buy stock to start her small shop she runs from tables inside a small room of her house. It is going well but she would like to build a special room with good shelves to sell her stocks. She hopes that her next loan will be used to complete that project, and make some repairs to her house. She appreciates the help she receives from this program because without it she could not run her business.

loans.use: To restock her shop

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina has always been interested in commerce. So, she started looking for a business that would give her some income to help support her family, and also make her feel good about her activity. After considering different products to sale, she decided for handicrafts, she got a few and sold them among friends. And now Agustina has many clients thanks to her ability for sales. She believes this is a noble enterprise, buying from craftsmen to sale their products is rewarding for them and for the customers who buy.

Christmas is coming, and in this season Agustina needs to stock more goods. She would like to keep the tradition alive. Agustina is asking for US$ 1050 loan to be repaid in 6 months. With the money she would be able to buy Christmas merchandise to sale, and maybe, with the returns, have a Christmas dinner with her family. She would be grateful for your help.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Ramón, Kiva Volunteer.

Agustina, desde pequeña le interesó el comercio, y buscó la manera de tener un negocio que le hiciera ganar dinero para ayudar en los gastos del hogar y para que ella se pudiera sentir agusto con lo que hace. Después de un tiempo de pensar qué era lo que iba a vender, decidió comprar un poco de artesanías para ofrecerlas entre sus amigos y hoy gracias a su carácter para vender, tiene un poco más de clientes, quienes prefieren comprarle a ella. Agustina considera que la venta de artesanías engrandece mucho el trabajo de todos nuestros artesanales a quienes ella les compra para poder ponerlo en manos de sus clientes.

Sin embargo con la época Navideña, Agustina necesita surtir su negocio con artesanías que engrandezcan las costumbres Navideñas, y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $1050 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Agustina podrá comprar artículos Navideños para obtener mayores ganancias y tener una Navidad con su familia con cena. Agustina te Agradece tu ayuda.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to sale in Christmas season

loans.name: Korina

texts.en: Korina is married with six kids that are all living together in one place with just two of them working. She had applied for a $300USD loan which was used to buy the ingredients such as cordials, sugar and plastic bags for her ice-cake business  . She sells them at school five days per week and in the village every day. She earns $45ST per day but if she produced more she could earn $65 per day. She hopes that her next loan will be used to buy a big freezer for the business replacing her current small and old one.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her ice-cake business

loans.name: Ni Putu Sukadani

texts.id:
Ni Putu Sukadani lives in Manistutu, one of the town at south Bali. It is located at a geographical location where most of the people work as a farmer, especially for Clove. usually the men will go out and work, and the female will stay at home and take care of the family, and only follow them when there is a harvest. However, Ni Putu Sukadani is not like the rest. She does not want to wait for her husband to put food on the table, therefore she started farming pigs. To increase her the quality of her yield, she has obtained financial assistance and training from Dinari. Recently, her sow had just given birth to 10 piglet. She intends to buy high quality pig feedings to fatten her pigs. And she will also used it to renovate her pig sty. Ni Putu Sukadani is optimistic that this will work out, therefor she works hard to ensure that this will increase their living standard.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Sukadani tinggal di desa Manistutu, sebuah desa yang ada di Bali barat. Desa Manistutu adalah salah satu desa di Bali barat yang kondisi geografisnya berada di ketinggian sehingga banyak penduduknya yang berprofesi sebagi petani, khususnya petani cengkeh. Kaum lelaki pergi ke kebun untuk mengolah tanah perkebunan dan kaum wanita tinggal dirumah untuk merawat anak dan keluarga. Biasanya kaum wanita di desa ini akan ikut ke kebun kalau pohon cengkeh sudah berbuah dan siap di panen. Ni Putu Sukadani adalah sosok wanita yang gigih dalam mengarungi hidupnya. Ia tidak ingin hanya tinggal dirumah berdiam diri dan menunggu suami datang dari kebun. Untuk membantu menambah pendapatan keluarganya, Ni Putu Sukadani memelihara babi dirumahnya, khususnya babi jenis lokal. Untuk meningkatkan kwalitas dari usahanya, Ni Putu Sukadani mendapat pelatihan dan pinjaman modal dari Dinari. Saat ini Ni Putu Sukadani memiliki seekor induk babi yang baru saja melahirkan 10 ekor anak. Pinjaman yang didapatnya akan digunakan untuk membelikan pakan yang lebih baik dan bergizi, karena selama ini masih memberikan pakan tradisional sehingga pertumbuhan babinya tidak optimal. Selain itu, pinjamannya akan digunakan untuk memperbaiki kandangnya yang sudah rusak. Dengan perencanaan yang baik, Ni Putu Sukadani optimis akan berhasil dengan usahanya. Karena itu, ia melakukannya dengan tekun dan yakin usaha ini akan dapat meningkatkan kesejahteraan hidup keluarganya.

loans.use: Membeli pakan babi yang berkwalitas dan memperbaiki kandang - To buy quality pig feedings and renovate pig sty.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Sieli

texts.en: Sieli is a married lady of thirty three years of age with three children. Her business is the selling of cooking foods such as chop-suey, curry with rice and Samoan taro at offices in town, school and the village. Her $300USD loan was used to buy all the materials like pots and containers, and ingredients needed for making the foods. She earns $125ST net profit per day with four working days but if she needs more money at a particular time she works six days. She believes this program is very useful to her, because without it she could not do it. She can also afford to make the repayments.

loans.use: To buy materials for her fast food stall

loans.name: Faleupolu

texts.en: Faleupolu is married with three kids, all of whom are in school. When she heard of this program, she joined and applied for $300USD and used the loan to start her fast foods stall business. At the moment, she supplies  lunch for one of the offices in town in addition to other people she delivers her food to. If there is any left she sometimes delivers to the school. She earns $130ST net profit per day and works five days per week. She is now very comfortable raising her family and providing her kids with school financial support. She hopes to stay long in the program.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her fast food stall

loans.name: Gusti Ayu Nyoman Rat

texts.id:
She lives with her husband and 3 children who are still schooling. To help ease her family burden Gusti Ayu Nyoman Ratniti started pig farming. However before this she didn't had the right knowledge to farm pigs, and didn't acquire maximum yield. She used to feed her pigs leftovers. However after receiving financial assistance from Dinari, she now rears 4 pigs and separate them into two sty to ease the job of cleaning. She also buys better pig feedings so that her pigs grows fat and healthy. Now with these improvements, she can now fetch higher prices for her pigs.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup dengan suami dan tiga orang anak yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah, tentunya membutuhkan banyak biaya. Begitu juga hal yang dialami oleh Gusti Ayu Nyoman Ratniti. Sudah menjadi tradisi wanita di desa, salah satu usaha yang dilakukan untuk menambah perekonomian keluarga adalah beternak babi. Namun yang menjadi kendala adala kurangnya pengetahuan akan beternak babi yang baik dan benar sehingga usaha yang ditekuni tidak menghasilkan dengan maksimal. Sebelumnya, Gusti Nyoman Ratniti hanya memelihara satu babi penggemukkan dan hanya diberi pakan tradisional yang berupa dedaunan dan sisa makanan di dapur. Hal seperti itu menyebabkan pertumbuhan babi tidak optimal dan tentunya berpengaruh terhadap harga jual. Setelah mendapat pembinaan dan pinjaman modal, sekarang Gusti Ayu Nyoman Ratniti memelihara 4 ekor babi yang dipisah dalam dua kandang. Hal itu dilakukannya untuk memudahkan perawatan dan pembersihan kandang. Pinjaman itu digunakan juga untuk membeli pakan yang berkwalitas sehingga sekarang pertumbuhan babinya pesat dan sehat. Dengan adanya perubahan cara beternak, hal ini berpengaruh terhadap pendapatan keluarganya, karena sekarang ia dapat menjual babinya dengan harga yang lebih

loans.use: Membeli bibit dan pakan - Buying piglets and pig feedings

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Talila

texts.en: Talila K. is a married woman of thirty one years of age with a daughter. She is very interested and good in baking cakes, pies, scorns, donuts and buns. She learned to bake from her mother. She applied for her first  $300USD loan and used it to buy the ingredients needed for her bakery business. She sells her baked goods at shops in the village and sometimes she has orders from shops in town. She thinks that her next loan will use to extend her business by building a small house dedicated to her bakery business only. She is very appreciative of the help she get from this program.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Ni Nengah Witoni

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Witoni's daily routine start at 5am, where she goes to the market to source for fresh goods such as vegetables. She operate a stall which sells a variety of household daily needs, which in turn finances her daily needs. Besides that, Ni Nengah Witoni also sells gado-gado (local delicacy). Her stalls start at 9am in the morning till 6 in the evening. Everyday she earns about Rp.15.000. This lessen the burden of her family. With the financial assistance from Dinari, she intends to have a permanent stall and also increase the variety of items that is being sold. During peak time, her husband also helps her out in her stall. The live in a modest home with 3 children. The financial assistance has benefited her, she has already felt the increase in her sales.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Bangun pukul 05.00 wita pagi dan pergi kepasar, untuk mencari bahan berjualan sudah menjadi kegiatan yang rutin bagi Ni Nengah Witoni. Karena bila masih pagi semua bahan yang diperlukan masih tersedia dan segar, seperti sayur - sayuran dan barang – barang kebutuhan pokok lainnya. Dengan membuka warung dan menjual barang kebutuhan sehari – hari, sangat membantu untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Selain menjual kebutuhan sehari – hari, Ni Nengah Witoni juga menjual gado – gado ( makanan tradisional yang terbuat dari beras yang dibungkus daun, lalu direbus. Setelah matang, beras akan mengeras dan kemudian dipotong – potong lalu dicampur dengan bumbu dan sayuran ). Warung Ni Nengah Witoni buka pukul 09.00 wita sampai dengan pukul 18.00 wita. Dari usaha ini Ni Nengah Witoni menerima keuntungan setiap hari Rp.15.000 bersih. Keuntungan ini sangat berguna dan sangat dirasakan karena bisa meringankan sedikit beban rumah tangganya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, ia rencanakan untuk menambah barang dagangan dan membuat lokasi warung yang lebih permanen, karena yang sekarang masih memanfaatkan halaman depan rumahnya untuk berjualan. Semakin hari usaha warung Ni Nengah Witoni semakin ramai. Kadang Nyoman Sukama, suami dari Ni Nengah Witoni, juga membantu bila warungnya ramai pembeli. Mereka tinggal dirumah yang sederhana dengan 3 orang anak. Pinjaman yang didapatnya dirasakan sangat membantu karena akan dapat meningkatkan usahanya

loans.use: Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli aneka barang dagangan kebutuhan sehari - hari - Increased capital to purchase more variety of items.

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Rosana

texts.en: Rosana is a very strong and a hard working woman of forty three years of age with five children. Her priority every morning and evening is the planting, weeding and watering of her garden. Her $300USD loan was all used to buy chemicals, fertilizers, and different vegetable seeds for plantings. She sells them at the village and at the market. She hopes that her next loan will be used to help in buying their second-hand pick-up for delivering her vegetables and on their way to the plantation.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and tools for her vegetable garden

loans.name: Karaponi

texts.en: Karaponi is a woman of forty two years of age who is married with three kids. She is very interested and talented in making elei materials which she learned from her school. Her first loan of $300USD was used to buy materials needed such as fabrics, paintings, brushes and elei woods. She sells them at shops in the village and she also has orders from shops in town as well as from choirs, school and youths. She hopes that her next loan will be used to build a small house for her business and provide additional materials. She is very interested in her business and thankful for  the help she gets from this program because without the assistance she could not make it.

loans.use: To buy materials for her elei (a traditional Samoan printing material) printing business

loans.name: Ni Kadek Suastini

texts.id:
Cutting hair has become main income for Ni Kadek Suastini. Even though she usually goes to her client's place to cut hair, she still maintains a salon at her home. Beside cutting hair, she also does help make-up for bridegrooms, and many of them are very happy with her work. However even not having clients everyday. She still manages to gain Rp.150.000 clean profit every month. This is used to assist her husband I Komang Suarmawa for their household expenses, and raising their child who is still schooling. With the financial assitance Ni Kadek Suastini intends to buy more make up tools to increase her selections, so that she can further serve her customer's better.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Memotong rambut sudah menjadi mata pencaharian bagi Ni Kadek Suastini. Walaupun sering dipanggil oleh pelanggan, Ni Kadek Suastini tetap membuka salon dirumah. Selain potong rambut, Ni Kadek Suastini juga bisa merias pengantin, baik tata rias pengantin adat bali maupun nasional. Banyak pelanggan yang senang dengan hasil riasannya. Tidak setiap hari ada yang kesalon tetapi dalam 1 bulan keuntungan yang diterima sangat memuaskan sebesar Rp.150.000,- bersih. Keuntungan ini digunakan untuk membantu suaminya, I Komang Suarmawa, dalam memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Dan menanggung biaya sekolah 1 orang anak. Ni Kadek Suastini berkeinginan menambah alat – alat untuk melengkapi perlengkapan salonnya agar bisa melayani pelanggannya dengan lebih baik lagi.

loans.use: Membeli perlengkapan salon - Buying salon items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Faapale

texts.en: Faapale is married with four kids and she is very good at sewing different types of clothes. She applies for a first time loan in the amount of $300USD. She will use the loan to buy all the materials needed for her business especially a new hand sewing machine which is a very expensive tool she currently cannot afford. She sells her sewing stuffs at the flea markets in town and she sometimes has orders from big shops. She hopes that her next loan will be used to make her business big and buy even more materials. She is very happy with her business and hopes to stay in it for a long time.

loans.use: To buy materials and supplies for her sewing business

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en: Ramil lives in Yenikand village in the Salyan region. He is married and has one child. This 29-year-old man has 7 years of experience in the farming business. He needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Valida

texts.en: Valida H. is a 40-year-old married woman with two children who lives in Khaladj village in the Salyan region. She has 10 years of experience in this business. Now Valida needs a loan of $1200 to buy pesticides and fertilizer for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Sahil

texts.en: Sahil is a married man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He is 37 years old and has 8 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to develop his farming.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Nasar

texts.en: Nasar lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and has a car parts shop in the main city of Kabul. He is the only person who supports his family because his father died during the war in Afghanistan. The shop is his only source of income. Now he wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his stock and increase his business. He wants to make a good monthly income to improve his family's living standard. He is happy now.

loans.use: To complete his stock

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman owns a vineyard and has run his business for 10 years. Elman is 48 years old and is married with two children. The B. family lives in Yenikand, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Elman would like a loan of $1200 to buy vine-props to improve the growing of his vines.

loans.use: To buy vine-props

loans.name: Samid

texts.en: Samid is 28 years old and single. Samid lives in Yenikand, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Samid has had his farming business for 4 years. Now he needs a loan of $725 to buy fertilizer and pesticides to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en: Elnur is a 25-year-old single man who lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Elnur has his own farm and 4 years of experience in this business. He would like a loan of $950 to buy pesticides and fertilizer. He plans to develop his farming business and increase his yields.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Amelia

texts.pt:
Amelia is single, but she lives with a man who has 3 children. Amelia's husband is unemployed. He lives from small jobs. And that's why Amelia decided to join the credit program. She wants to use the money to invest in her business to see the business grow, and she can use the profit to help her husband pay household expenses and the children's schooling.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Amelia e solteira, mas vive com um homem de quem tem 3 filhos. O marido de Amelia nao esta empregado. Vive de pequenos expedientes. E por isso que Amelia decidiu entrar para o programa de credito.Ela quer usar o dinheiro para investir no seu negocio para ver se o negocio cresce e ela possa usar os rendimentos para ajudar o marido no pagamento das despesas da casa e da escola dos filhos.

loans.use: Amelia wants to use the loan to buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Ni Wayan Twi

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Twi aged 50 lives with her husband I Wayan Sidia lives in their modest home in a hindu town South Bali. They have 4 children who all now lives separately with their own family. Their home is made out of hollow brick and rough cement. To face their daily lives, Ni Wayan Twi works on farming pigs. With her current capital she has 2 pigs, which she sells after 4 months for each around Rp. 250.000 to Rp. 300.000. However this is barely sufficient to buy pig feedings on top of their daily expenses which is around Rp. 20.000. After receiving training and finance from Dinari, Ni Wayan Twi intends to grow her business. She intends to buy piglets and build a bigger pig sty. She estimates that her piglets outputs will increased by 8-10. And with the training provided, she will be able to gain more profit. She has also made plans on saving and paying back her loans. Ni Wayan Twi hopes that her business will be succesful.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Twi, 50 tahun, tinggal bersama suaminya, I Wayan Sidia, dirumahnya yang sederhana di sebuah desa Hindu di Bali Barat. Mereka memiliki 4 orang anak, namun saat ini keempat anaknya sudah berkeluarga dan tinggal dengan keluarganya masing – masing. Rumah mereka semi permanen, terbuat dari dinding batako dan lantai semen kasar. Untuk mencukupi kebutuhan hidup sehari – hari, Ni Wayan Twi menekuni usaha beternak babi. Dengan modal yang dimilikinya sekarang, 2 ekor anak babi, Ni Wayan Twi bisa menjualnya setelah dipelihara 4 bulan. Per ekor dijual dengan harga Rp. 250.000.- s / d Rp. 300.000.- Hasil tersebut dirasakan sangat minim, karena masih harus dikurangi dengan biaya pakan dan juga harus memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari – hari yang mencapai Rp. 20.000.- Setelah mendapat pembinaan cara beternak babi yang baik dari yayasan Dinari, Ni Wayan Twi ingin meningkatkan usahanya. Dengan pinjaman yang didapatnya, Ni Wayan Twi berencana untuk membeli seekor induk yang sudah siap dikawinkan. Untuk itu, ia juga menggunakan pinjaman untuk membangun kandang baru yang lebih baik dan besar untuk anak babinya nanti. Dengan menambah populasinya, perhitungan Ni wayan Twi, induk babinya akan beranak 8 s / d 10 ekor. Dalam perawatan dan pemeliharaan selama 4 bulan, penjualan babinya akan mendapatkan hasil yang lebih banyak dari sebelum ia mendapat pelatihaan dan pinjaman modal. Ni Wayan Twi juga sudah memperhitungkan untuk menyisihkan keuntungan yang ia akan dapatkan untuk modal dan juga untuk mengembalikan pinjamannya nanti. Ni Wayan Twi berharap usahanya akan sukses, pinjamannya bisa dilunasi dan ia akan bisa mandiri dengan usahanya

loans.use: Membeli induk dan membuat kandang - Buying piglet and building a pig sty

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Ni Made Sekariani

texts.id:
Having the knowledge of pig farming is essential for any pig farmer. Ni Made Sekariani a mother of 3 face problem of insufficient yield and lack of capital. This caused her to be very afraid and skeptical to expand her business. And being a women, she is shy and afraid to acknowledge that these requires more capital. However after receiving financial assistance from Dinari, this changed her perspective, as she realize that she must do well to raise her 3 children who are still in school. And most importantly, her husband Made Supartika has also lend a hand in doing this. With the capital, she intend to buy good quality pig feedings, so that her pigs can grow fat and healthy. Recently one of her sow has also gave birth to 10 piglets. She also intends to build a bigger pig sty. With the capital and knowledge gained, Ni Made Sekariani is confident that her business will grow.

Translated from Bahasa by Bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Pengetahuan tentang beternak babi yang baik dan benar, adalah suatu hal yang mesti dimiliki oleh seseorang sebelum menekuni usaha tersebut. Hal itu juga terjadi pada Ni Made Sekariani, seorang ibu dengan 3 orang anak. Karena keterbatasan pengetahuan dan rasa takut untuk berkembang, seringkali usahanya tidak mendapatkan hasil yang optimal. Wanita didesa seringkali malu dan takut, bahwa untuk mengembangkan usaha perlu latihan dan dana yang mencukupi. Setelah mendapat pembinaan dari yayasan Dinari, pikiran Ni Made Sekariani mulai terbuka. Ni Made Sekariani menyadari bahwa usaha yang ditekuninya semuanya untuk memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya, apalagi dengan ketiga anaknya sedang duduk di bangku pendidikan. Yang lebih penting, sekarang ini suaminya, I Made Supartika, juga mendukung usaha yang ditekuni istrinya. Dengan modal pinjaman yang didapatnya, Ni Made Sekariani berencana untuk membeli pakan yang berkwalitas agar pertumbuhan babinya maksimal dan sehat. Kebetulan saat ini babinya baru saja melahirkan anak sebanyak 10 ekor. Ni Made Sekariani juga berencana untuk membuat kandang yang baik, karena selama ini babinya belum memiliki tempat yang memadai. Dengan pengetahuan dan dana yang sudah didapatnya, Ni Made Sekariani yakin usahanya akan berkembang dengan baik.

loans.use: Membeli pakan dan membuat kandang - Buying Pig Feedings and Building a pig sty

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for DINARI Foundation - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Alice Jose

texts.pt:
Alice is single, but lives with a man who has 2 children. Alice's husband works in the machamba (a small agricultural field). She lives with her family in Chissano, an administrative post located in the Bilene district in the Province of Gaza, Mozambique. She sells in a market in Chissano, and in addition to selling clothes, sometimes she also sells vegetables grown in the family fields. Alice's children are studying. Alice joined the credit program this year. with her earnings, she will help her husband with household expenses and pay for the children's schooling.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Alice e solteira mas vive com um homem de quem tem 2 filhos. Marido de Alice trabalha na machamba. Ela vive com sua familia em Chissano , um posto administrativo localizado no distrito de Bilene na Provincia de Gaza. Ela vende num mercado em Chissano. para alem da venda de roupa as vezes ela vende tambem legumes produzidos na machamba familiar. Os filhos de Alice estao a estudar. Alice entrou para o programa de credito neste ano. Com os rendimentos ela vai ajudar o marido nas despesas da casa e pagar a escola dos filhos.

loans.use: Alice wants to use the money to purchase more clothing for sale

loans.name: Ramal

texts.en: Ramal lives in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. Ramal is 26 years old and single. He has raised cattle for 4 years. He would like a loan of $950 to buy fodder and baling presses, and keep his cattle well fed. Ramal hopes to increase the number of his cattle to improve his business and to increase his income.

loans.use: To buy feed and baling presses for his cattle

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 23185

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en: Vasif is 42, married, and has 2 children. He lives with his family in Salyan region, Khaladj village. He has his own farm. Vasif started his business 10 years ago. He plans to buy fertilizer in order to improve his business, and therefore he is applying for a loan of $725.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

payments.comment: Correction due to overpayment for business 23186

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is 36 years old and married. She sells snacks, candies and flavored blended ice, earning about $5.50 - $6.50 per day. Her husband Armin is a worker  who earns about $22 per week. Lina is requesting a loan to buy more goods and earn more income to support her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods

loans.name: Ofah

texts.en: Ofah is 42 years old and married. She lives with her son and her mother. Her other children are married and live away from her. She sells household goods on credit. Ofah is requesting a loan to expand her and her husband's business. They hope that this will earn more income for their children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Shakhin

texts.en: Shakhin (his son is pictured) is a 42-year-old, married man who has one child. He lives with his son in Khaladj, in the Salyan region of Azerbaijan. He has raised cattle for 10 years and finds this a good way to support his family. He would like a loan of $1200 to buy feed and baling presses for his cattle.

loans.use: To buy  feed and baling presses for his cattle

loans.name: Erumsiah

texts.en:
Erumsiah is 40 years old and married with 3 children aged 13,11 and 9. She sells rice and fried snacks by going around her village every day. She has to work to support her family's living expenses. She usually earns $6.50 a day, which is not enough for her family's needs. Her husband sells rice at the market and earns up to $55 per month.

Erumsiah is requesting a to complete her business, and hopes that this will improve her family's income. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Siti

texts.en:
Siti M. is 23 years old and married with one child, aged 3. She runs a small shop selling snacks and a few household items, earning her about $5 a day. Her husband Agus has an unfixed source of income.

Siti needs a loan to buy more goods and complete her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods and complete her shop

loans.name: Iyoh

texts.en:
Iyoh is 23 years old and married with two children. She runs a small shop selling snacks and some household items, earning about $7 per day. Her husband Ujang sells food in Bogor and usually earns about $22 a week.

Iyoh needs a loan to buy more goods and complete her shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To buy more goods and complete her shop

loans.name: Thi Lien

texts.vi:
Ms Liên was born and grew up in a poor village in the district of Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. She is married and has 2 school age children. She had occupied different jobs: a laborer for hire, sells metal waste material, sells vegetables that she cultivated. She does not have money to start up any kind of business. She has always wished to have some funding that would enable her to be self employed and generate a revenue. She is very happy to learn that the funding program just became available in her village and she is able to qualify based on her situation. She will buy chicks to raise, she will pay back with the money from the sale of the chickens.

Translated by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Liên sinh ra và lớn lên tại tại một làng quê nghèo ở huyện Yên Phong, Bắc Ninh. Chị đã có chồng và 2 con đang tuổi đến trường. Chị đã làm rất nhiều nghề để kiếm sống như đi làm thuê, buốn sắt vụn, trồng rau mang ra chợ bán. Vì không có vốn nên chị phải làm ăn nhỏ lẻ. Chị luôn ước mơ có vốn để hỗ trợ cho chị trong các hoạt động tạo thu nhập. Khi được biết có chương trình tài chính vi mô về tận thôn, chị rất vui mừng vì hình thức cho vay rất phù hợp với hoàn cảnh của chị, chị không phải thế chấp cái gì mà vẫn có vốn. Chị mong có vốn để mua gà về nuôi và thu nhập từ việc bán gà sẽ dùng để hoàn vốn.

loans.use: To purchase baby chicken to raise

loans.name: Alinyikira Lending Group

texts.en:
Rose is 23 years old, married with one child.  She also takes care of 3 orphans.  She is the chairperson for  the Alinyikira Lending Group in Makindye.  Makindye is located on a sloping hill, which offers soft breezes from the valley below and sweeping views.  It is on the outskirts of Kampala.  

There is one steep main dirt road leading into the district and walking paths to the homes and businesses.  Most businesses serve only the people within their own village.  When I visited, the shade trees were in bloom and many birds were feeding on their nectar.  As is the case in most villages, many people pass the time by visiting and watching after their children as they play.  Everyone knows everyone and the routine of each day is similar to the day before.  People are easy to smile and laugh.

For the past 3 years, Rose has operated a general store in Makindye.  Her store sells sugar, soap, salt and cooking oil along with foodstuffs such as onions, green peppers, eggplant, sugar cane, tomatoes, g-nuts and dried fish.

Rose is a young, energetic and well organized person, which is one of the reasons she is her lending group's chairperson.  As with most young adults, she has strong dreams for her family's future.  She wants to build her business so that it is the best store in Makindye.  One day, she plans to buy a plot of land and to build her own home.  For now, she plans to use her loan to buy supplies for her store including sugar, salt, cooking oil and more produce.

loans.use: Rose plans to use her loan to enlarge her business inventory.  She plans to buy supplies in larger quantities.  Items like salt, cooking oil and sugar can be had at a discount when bought in larger quantities.

loans.name: Hotim

texts.en:
Hotim is 30 years old and married with one child, aged 7. She runs a small shop which sells snacks, food and drinks, along with household products, earning about $5.50 per day. Her husband, Suki, is a framer who earns about $10 per week.

Hotim is requesting a loan to complete her business. The rest of the loan will be used for her husband business. Hotim hopes to improve her income so that she can provide for her children's education. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her business

loans.name: Aam

texts.en: Aam is 45 years old and married with two children, aged 22 and 20. She runs a business selling medicinal herbs. Occassionally, she assists as a midwife with a neighbour's childbirth, and also earns some income from rendering this service. As a widow, Aam is the only person left to fight and provide for her and her children's lives. She is requesting a loan  to expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti M. is 21 years old and married with one child, aged 5. Her husband has no fixed income and is only able to find employment with the odd job or two. Therefore, to contribute to her family's income, she sells food and snacks at her small kiosk. She usually earns $10 per day, which is not enough to cover her family's daily needs. Therefore, Siti is requesting a loan of 500,000 Indonesian Rupiah to expand her business. Siti M. is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma Y. is 22 years old and married. She sells clothes on credit, and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Her husband, Amin, is a worker who earns a salary of $33 per month. Irma hopes to earn more to supplement her husband's income. She usually earns $5 per day and the profit will be used to buy more goods for their business. Irma Y. is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Ikoh

texts.en: Ikoh is 32 years old and married with two children, aged 13 and 5. She runs a business selling household goods such as cooking oil, rice, eggs, etc. Her husband, Asmita, is jobless and usually helps her run her shop everyday. Ikoh usually earns $1.50 per day in profit.  She is a member of MBK and needs a  loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To complete her shop

loans.name: Juriyah

texts.en: Juriyah is 25 years old and married with one child, aged 1. She sells clothes, sheets and bed covers on credit and has been running her business for quite a long time. She usually earns $2 per day. Juriyah is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to expand her business and generate more income. She willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Suhartini

texts.en: Suhartini is 27 years old and married. She sells clothes and fabrics on credit. She goes from door to door to seek customers and collects payment at the end of each month. She can earn up to $10 per week doing this. Suhartini is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan to expand her business and earn more income to support her children's education. She willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Nurhayati

texts.en: Nurhayati is 40 years old and married. Nurhayati runs a business selling snacks, household goods and beverages. Her business supplements her family's income, usually earning $2 per day. Her husband, Ujang, has an irregular stream of income. Nurhayati is a member of MBK and is requesting a loan so that she can expand her shop. The remainder will be used to improve her husband's business. She willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To make expand her shop

loans.name: Anih

texts.en:
Anih is 51 years old and married. She makes and sells an Indonesian salad called “gado-gado”, working from her small shop from 8 in the morning until evening. She also sells other food like crackers, snacks and some vegetables at the shop.

Her husband passed away some time ago, so she is the only one left to fight for her and her child's lives. Anih is a member of MBK and is reqesting a loan so that she can earn more income for her child’s education. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mardiah

texts.en: Mardiah  is 25 years old and is married with one child aged 6. She has been running a business selling waste and scrap materials which she collects and sells.  She usually earns a profit of $1.50 per day while her husband Warsa works i a syrup factory. His income is unfixed, earning her only $13  per week.  She is urgently requesting a loan so that she can expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a proud mother and owner of a street-side cloth, uniform, and undershirt shop. Her 18 year-old son just completed his final year in high school and is currently helping his mother at her shop, but only for a year because he wants to attend university soon.

Doris has had the business for 3 years, but the shop has been around for over 20 years! Her sister, Julie, passed the shop over to her 3 years ago so she could start a new uniform store down the block. Doris’s business has been around for so many years because of her many loyal patrons. Doris attributes the success of the shop to the good relationships she maintains with her customers and the quality of her products.

However, there have been some customers Doris had to turn away due to limited diversity of her stock. She wants to start improving the shop by adding more selection to the colors and brands of cloth she carries. With her loan, she will be able to purchase new rolls of cloth at $46 each. In the near future, she sees her store carrying more uniforms and undershirts as well, but her long-term goal is to move out of her street-side shop and into an indoor shop.

loans.use: Mainly to diversify the colors and brands of cloth she carries at her shop, but also to purchase more uniforms and undershirts.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Quluyev Ali is 49 years old and father of three children. He is from the Azerbaijan-Armenian conflict territory Lachin region, situated in the western part of Azerbaijan.

Right now he lives in Sumgayit city with his family. He is the only breadwinner in his family. He is a cab driver.

He began his business 11 years ago. Ali is a well-experienced driver. But this job is very difficult. He rents a car to earn enough money for his family.

He has already gathered some money for buying a car, but it is not enough. So, he needs to borrow some more money. Аli would like to receive a $1,000 loan in order to buy a car, to build a garage for his car and to buy necessary tools and equipment. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy a car, to build garage for his car and to buy necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a charming 42-year-old mother of four. Between taking care of her 4 children and supporting her son through the local computer institute, she finds time to manage her street-side shop, where she sells bed sheets, towels, children’s clothes, and underwear.

She started the business 12 years ago, and her client base has steadily grown ever since, though she has faced some challenges over the years. Her challenges are the typical issues associated with having a street-side shop. The weather is harsh in Kumasi. The sun can be damaging to her products over time. Furthermore, when it rains, Mercy has to quickly pack up her store until the clouds clear again. To alleviate some of these problems, Mercy hopes to eventually move into an indoor shop in the middle of the central market.

For now, she is saving money by increasing her product selection. In particular, she wants to add boxer shorts to her stock for the Christmas season. Boxer shorts are very popular but are relatively more expensive to purchase than her other products. When she gets her loan, she will be able to purchase 140 pairs before Christmas.

loans.use: To purchase boxer shorts for the Christmas season

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: Zaur is a single man. He has his own shop where he sells household goods. He is 23 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz. He has four years of experience in this business. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy goods to improve his business and get more income.

loans.use: To buy goods for improving his business

loans.name: Etiram

texts.en:
H. Etiram is an Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict territory Khocavand region, situated in the western part of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. He is 37 years old and single. He lives with his parents.

Etiram is the only breadwinner in family. Having borrowed a loan amount of $500 from Normicro, he rented a shop. The second time, he borrowed $700 and built the grocery store. The loans were paid back in a timely manner. The third time he applied for a loan of $1,000 to expand the shop and to increase the food assortments. He has already overcome this obstacle, too, and paid his monthly payments in time.

Now, he needs $1,200. With this loan, he will to expand his business, open a vegetable section and buy different sort of foods. He hopes eventually to expand his business. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To expand his business, open a vegetable section and to buy different sort of foods

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 23209

loans.name: Trinity Womens Lending Group

texts.en:
Sarah is a very friendly and hardworking businessperson. She is 30 years old, married with two children. She also cares for one orphaned child. She is the chairperson of Trinity Womens Lending Group. In the photo, she is the one sitting in the front row on the right. The lending group meets once a week in one of the classrooms at the Mperewe High School, a private school. The members meet to discuss topics concerning their loans and businesses. This is also a time to do a lot of social networking. Since all are business owners, they tend to be very involved in their village and are often on other committees that support the well being of their communities. 

The village of Mperewe is located on a very busy road on the outskirts of Kampala. Although the road bisects the town, it is very good for roadside businesses. The roadsides are alive with people selling hot food from small charcoal cookers, beverages from small huts, women selling bananas that they carry in baskets on their heads, boda boda (motorbikes) drivers offering rides as people exit matatoos (passenger vans). Everywhere there are people walking, visiting, trading, etc. It is a very vibrant place to be. 

Sarah owns the Benoneto Shoe Wholesale, a wholesale shoe business. With the holiday season approaching she is interested in increasing her inventory of shoes. This is one of the busiest times for her business. In time she hopes to be able to buy a plot of land and build a home.

loans.use: Sarah plans to use her loan to buy more shoes for her wholesale shoe business. The holidays are approaching and this is her busiest season.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir has a shop where he sells clothes and shoes for men. He is 23 years old, single, and lives in Khachmaz town. This young man has been in this business for 3 years. Now he needs a loan of $950 to buy clothes and shoes for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for improving his business

loans.name: Djeyhun

texts.en: Djeyhun is 28 years old, divorced, and lives in Khachmaz town. This young man repairs radiators of cars. He has been in this business for 2 years. He needs a loan of  $825 to buy needed materials for repairing radiators.

loans.use: To buy needed materials for repairing  radiators of cars

payments.comment: Correction due to underpayment for business 23212

loans.name: Zinunula Lending Group

texts.en:
Deborah is the chairperson for the Zinunula Lending Group in Nansana on the outskirts of Kampala.  She is 51 years old, married with 6 children.  She also cares for 4 orphans.  In Uganda it is more the custom than the exception to care for orphaned children.  Although it creates a bond in villages where everyone is caring for the children of deceased brothers and sisters, it also keeps people from being able to save and get out of poverty.  For most, it would be unthinkable to not care for the orphaned children.

Deborah's lending group is meeting in the home of one of its members.  They are very business oriented and spend a great deal of time entering loan payments and discussing finances.  For many women in lending groups, this is their first exposure to borrowing and they take great pride in doing everything right.

Deborah owns a paraffin business.  Paraffin is fuel that is pumped into plastic jerry cans which people bring to her site along the road.  Paraffin or fuel is used for cooking, lighting and as an additive to house paint.  Electricity can be very random, so paraffin for lighting the homes at night is critical.

Deborah plans to use her loan to buy more paraffin.  She is also planning to open another location for a new pump.  She is very goal oriented and will no doubt achieve her goal of having another business site.

loans.use: Deborah plans to use her loan to buy more paraffin fuel for her business.

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Aygun (her husband is pictured) is 23 years old. She does not have children. She lives in Khacmaz region in the Gimil-Gushlag village. Four years ago she started this business. She needs a loan of $1200 to buy fertilizer and pesticide for improving her farm.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Kamila

texts.en: Kamila is a  mother of four  children and lives in the town of Khachmaz. She is 59 years old and has been breeding poultry for the past four years.
