Most of the businesses are located on the main road and are better stocked and have more variety than businesses in villages off of paved roads. There is also more competition, and people pay higher rents for the exposure. Businesses can cater to people outside their communities.

Such is the case with Robinah. She and her husband have the Fairy Star Electrical Center. They are an electrical retailer and wholesaler. They provide electrical wire, switches, panel boxes for electricians, and light bulbs such as energy-saving fluorescents for homeowners.

Robinah is 38 and married with 4 children. She also takes care of 2 orphans. With her loan, she plans to buy more electrical supplies for her store.

loans.use: Robinah plans to use her loan to buy electrical products, i.e. wire, switches, lighting fixtures, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en: Nurana (her husband is pictured) is 25 years old. She does not have a child. Her husband has his own car. He transports wares from villages to markets. 12 years ago they started this business. Now they need a loan of $825 to buy spare parts for their car. They live in the Khachmaz region, in the Mursali-Gishlag village.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Rafik

texts.en: Rafik has a bakery in which he sells what is called a 'mankouché,' which is dough on which is added thyme or other ingredients. The 'makouche' is very tasty and very well-known in Lebanon. Rafik bakes the 'mankouche' and sells it in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. He is 30 years old and wants to buy enough flour to stock it because the price of that item is getting more and more expensive. Rafik is an ambitious man who also opened a vegetable shop in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: To buy enough flour for his bakery

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. has owned the Josephine Mini Shop for the past twenty years. When she was asked who Josephine is, she smiled and said that was her first-born daughter. Mary is married with two children, and she also cares for 2 orphans. Mary sells sugar, soap, cooking oil, and salt, along with personal hygiene items, at the mini shop in her village of Kikajjo on the outskirts of Kampala. Many of the retail stores sell very similar products. There are at least two reasons. First, the needs of people with little means are not varied; they are buying essentials, not luxuries. And second, one does not want to take a risk and fail at a business, as there is no safety net. So, you stock what you know will sell. Currently, Mary's inventory of products is low, so she plans to use her loan to replenish her stock of cooking goods.

Mary is also the treasurer for the Nyikira Okole Women’s Lending Group. Lending groups are quite common in villages. They act as a kind of peer pressure to encourage members to make sure they make their repayments on time. There also tends to be a strong bond among the members, and they are often strong members in their communities.

loans.use: Mary plans to use her loan to buy cooking supplies, i.e. cooking oil, salt, soap, sugar, etc. for her retail shop.

loans.name: Nadir

texts.en: Nadir (his brother is pictured) was born in 1977. This man, with his brother, buys agricultural produce from villages and sells it wholesale. Nadir lives in Khachmaz town. Now they are applying for a loan of $825 to buy agricultural produce.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is the owner of the Seaman Bar in Kikajjo on the outskirts of Kampala. She is also the vice chairperson for the Nyikira Okole Women’s Lending Group. She is 27 years old and married with two children. She also takes care of 2 orphans. At her bar she serves beer, sodas and spirits. Bars are much more than drinking establishments. They are places for people to gather and visit. Most villages will have one bar. Often the beer is made in-house. Beer is made with millet, sorghum or bananas, with yeast added to the first two versions but not to the bananas. The bananas are first covered with banana leaves and buried in the ground for 3 days. Then they are unwrapped and cooked slightly and reburied for 3 more days. Then they are brought out and mashed in a cut-out log and put into ceramic jars and allowed to ferment for 14 days. Betty plans to use her loan to expand her business and to add food items.

loans.use: To expand her business and add food items

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a blacksmith who lives in south Lebanon in the region of Nabatieh. Mohamad is 45 years old and has two children. This is the second time Mohamad is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs to generate enough revenue to be able to buy fuE. oil to heat his house during the winter. Mohamad does not want his family to suffer the cold winter and is determined to do the best he can to insure their well-being.

loans.use: To buy fuel oil to heat his house during the winter

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is the secretary for the Nyikira Okole Women’s Lending Group in Kikajjo on the outskirts of Kampala. She also owns SK and Sons Stationers, a secretarial bureau. She is very organized and business oriented. She has owned the business for 4 years and has a regular clientele. Sarah knows what equipment she needs to serve her customers. Currently she is able to print documents, laminate, photocopy and bind. She has 3 computers, and she also sells assorted paper.

With her loan she plans to buy another printer that will be able to scan, photocopy and print. In time, her plan is to get more machines. Eventually she will get a high-speed printer. Her business is growing and the demand is high for this professional woman’s services.

loans.use: To buy another printer for her secretarial business

loans.name: Nasraddin

texts.en: Nasraddin (his sister is pictured) is 47 years old, married, and has four children. He lives with his family in the Khachmaz region, in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. He and his sister need a loan of $825 to buy fruit seedlings and  fertilizer for improving their orchard. They have run this business for four years.

loans.use: To buy fruit seedlings and  fertilizer

loans.name: Nkwanzi Peace

texts.en:
Nkwanzi Peace has a very well-stocked business on a very busy road between Kampala and Entebbe in the village of Zana. Actually, she has three businesses under one roof. In her small storefront she has a boutique women’s clothing business, a housewares business and a video rental business. She carefully displays her items in a very orderly way in her limited space. She is very hardworking and has a lot of traffic at her location.

Eventually Nkwanzi Peace hopes to be able to sell her domestic wares wholesale to other shops. These consist mostly of plastic laundry baskets, glassware and pitchers. She works hard so that she can pay school fees for her children and eventually buy a plot of land and build a small house. For now, she plans to use her loan to buy more of the domestic products, as they sell the fastest.

loans.use: To purchase more domestic products for her store

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en: Fawzi is a 42 year old butcher who lives in south Lebanon, in the region of Nabatieh. Fawzi is divorced and has a son. This is the fourth time Fawzi has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He needs to buy cows for his butcher shop. His clients are usually the surrounding neighbors. Fawzi is striving to generate enough revenue to take care of his son and to provide for the family.

loans.use: To buy cows for his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence owns a small restaurant within an open-air roadside produce market. For three years she owned a restaurant at a different location, but then she lost a child at birth and had to close. She is now ready to start again and has operated at this site for one month.

Her restaurant is very neat and clean. She has taken great care in making it bright and inviting. It is a good location. She serves typical Ugandan food: Matooke, a steamed or cooked banana dish; cassava, tubers; sweet potatoes; posho, a maize flour dish; rice; beef stew; fish; beans; peas; and tea. The diet of most Ugandans varies little, but is usually not lacking in nutrients, as all products are fresh and there are plenty of fruits and vegetables grown in adjacent fields.

With her loan, Florence plans to buy a deep fryer, a fridge and some more chairs for her restaurant. In the future, she would like to add a takeaway service so that she can deliver to people in the area. Florence is married with one child, and she cares for 2 orphans.

loans.use: To buy a deep fryer, a fridge and some chairs for her restaurant

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Villages usually have one person who has a charcoal business. In Zana, that’s Annet. These are good, solid businesses that most owners operate for long periods of time. Everyone uses charcoal. Charcoal is relatively cheap, so people use it in their cookers. Restaurants tend to have cookers outdoors in front of the business. At home, people keep their cookers next to the front door. As they cook, they can also visit with their neighbors and look after their children.

The charcoal tends to be kept in wooden sheds that can be locked at night. Behind Annet in the picture you can see the 50kg bags of charcoal. People will come to her with small plastic containers, often only enough for 3-4 cups of charcoal, which she will fill. Most people do not have enough money to buy anything more than what they will use that day. So, each day they have to get charcoal, go to market, etc. Annet has operated her business for 8 years and she has been in her lending group for 4 years. With her loan she will buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara has a small produce stand on a very rutted dirt road in Zana. But the road is well trafficked with pedestrians, so her location is good. She has operated this stand for 4 years. Today she is selling tomatoes, cabbage, passion fruit, banana leaves and sugar cane. The banana leaves are used to cover mashed bananas which are then steamed or boiled to make the dish called matooke. Bananas are the largest part of villagers' diet.

She plans to use her loan to buy more produce for her stand. Produce stands are quite common. There is little variation in the products they sell, though the products change regularly, depending on what is ripening. Barbara is married, age 32 and has 3 children.

loans.use: To buy more produce for her roadside stand

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman (his brother is pictured) has been in this business for five years. He was born in 1962, is married, and has three children. He lives in the Khacmaz region, in the Yeni-Hayat settlement. He needs a loan of $825 to buy fertilizer and pesticides for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is the well-groomed, business-oriented owner of Bana Mityana Enterprises. Her store, which sells a well-stocked and varied assortment of cosmetics, lotions, shampoos and soaps, is located on a steep path just a hundred yards from a well-traveled road in the village of Zana. A lot of shops here are standalone shanties. Customers do not enter the store; instead they come up to the counter and ask to see the products. Edith has been in business for the past three years and has a second store with the same products in the next village. She is growth-oriented and wants to expand and get into a larger location. She also wants to diversify and own a petrol station. For now, though, she plans to use her loan to keep both of her cosmetic stores well stocked.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics, shampoos, lotions, etc., for her two stores

loans.name: Elman

texts.en: Elman lives in the Khachmaz region, in the Yeni-Hayat settlement. He is married and has two children. This 37-year-old man has his own orchard. To improve his orchard, he requests a loan of  $825 to purchase seedlings.

loans.use: To buy seedlings

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida was born in 1955, is married, and has four children. She lives with her family in Khachmaz town. Farida has been in this business for four years. She and her sister (pictured) buy the agricultural produce for pickles, which they sell. Now they need a loan of $725 to buy agricultural produce and necessary things to make pickled tomatoes, cucumbers, etc.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce and necessary things for pickles

loans.name: Mekhriban

texts.en: Mekhriban (her brother is pictured) has run this business for eight years. She is 23 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Khachmaz region, in Ashagi-Zeyid village. Now she needs a loan of $725 to buy cattle to breed to increase the number of their cattle.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Sumina

texts.en:
Mrs. Sumina S. is a 25 year old woman who lives in a single family home in Tangal, Lalitpur. Tangal is one of the busy bazaars of Lalitpur. She has four members in her family including herself. Her husband is Krishna S.. He crafts different idols of gods and goddess. Her son is studying in grade 7 and her daughter is in primary school.

Mrs. S. sells different types of flowers in her shop. In Nepal, November is the month of festival. The Nepalese celebrate Dashain and Tihar in this month. On these occasions people buy many different kinds of flowers to offer to the gods and goddesses. In this month the demand for flowers is very high. She seeks a loan to buy different varities of flowers. She wishes to spend what she earns to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy varities of flowers

loans.name: Keshari

texts.en:
Mrs. Keshari M. is a 33 year old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. Tangal is one of the very busy bazaars of Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband. Her husband Mr. Krishna M. works in a private office.

Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop two years ago. She makes different types of custom fitted lady's dresses in her shop. She prefers to makes lady's dresses like kurta-salwar, blouses, petticoats, lady's long dresses and dresses for newborn babies. She had six months of training in tailoring work from a local tailoring shop. She is now asking for her first loan to buy raw materials like clothes, threads, and a cutting machine for her tailoring work.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her tailoring work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Kanchi

texts.en:
Mrs. Kanchi M. lives in a single family home with her husband, three sons and her daughter. Her husband Mr. Aasta lal M. works in his own grocery shop. Her oldest son works in a food shop. Her next son works in a private office and her youngest son is studying in school.

Mrs. M. opened her tailoring shop four years ago. Her daughter helps her in the shop. Mrs. M. makes different types of custom fitted lady's dresses like kurta-salwar, blouses, and trousers for girls and ladies. She took six months of tailoring training from a local tailoring shop. Now she seeks a loan to buy raw materials for her tailoring shop.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her tailoring work

loans.name: Mehbara

texts.en: Mehbara (her husband is pictured) is 32 years old, lives in Khachmaz town. Her husband  has seven years of experience in this business. This young man builds the houses. Now they need  a loan of $600 to buy necessary materials for building the houses.

loans.use: to  buy necessary materials for building the houses.

loans.name: Dipu

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipu M. is a 35 year old lady who lives in Tangal, Lalitpur. She lives in a single family home with her husband Mr. Mangal M. and their two sons. Her older son is in grade 8 and her younger son is in primary school.

Mrs. M. and her husband opened their kitchenware shop five years ago. In their shop they sell different types of steel items like dinner plates, glasses, jugs, spoons, cups, cooking pots and much more. The revenue from the shop meets the basic needs of the family. Now they are requesting their fifth loan to buy more steel goods and expand the shop.

loans.use: To buy kitchenware items

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is a 55 year old widow and mother of 4 children. She started with Al Majmoua in 2003 to help her pay the university tuition fees for her children. Fatima lives in the south of Lebanon, in the region of Saida. She is striving to provide for her family through her tailoring work. She needs to buy a new sewing machine to increase her productivity and better support herself and her family.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Mrs. Alina S. is a 21 year old lady who lives in a joint family home with her father-in-law, mother-in-law, her husband and one daughter. They live in Tangal, Lalitpur. Her father-in-law and her husband make different traditional idols. Her daughter is in pre-primary school.

Mrs. S. sells many kinds of flowers in her shop. This month the demand for flowers is very high because the Nepalese need lots of flowers to celebrate the festival of Tihar. People buy different flowers to worship the goddess Laxmi. Mrs. Shrestha is requesting her second loan to buy varities of flowers in her shop, which can then sell to make a quick profit this month.

loans.use: To buy flowers for the occassion of Tihar

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani has a long history with A. Majmoua. This is the sixth loan he is requesting. Hani first joined the association to buy enough merchandise for his restaurant. Then, his loans were for the decoration of his restaurant. Now he needs to buy equipment like a grill and a mixer to keep developing his business. Therefore, he is requesting this loan.

Hani is a hard working man of 41 years. He lives with his wife and 2 children in the south of Lebanon, in the region of Saida.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his restaurant

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Laxmi Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Laxmi Kumari M. is a 52 year old lady who lives in Thecho. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this area farm to make a living. Mrs. M. has seven members in her family including herself. Her husband Mr. Bal Mukunda M. is a laborer in home construction work. Her three older sons are engaged in traditional work making idols and her younger two sons are studying in grade 6 and 5, respectively.

Mrs. M. works as a gas boiler. She fills oxygen in gas cylinders. For her work she seeks a loan to buy carbon. She spends what she earns to pay the household expenses and also to provide a better education for her children.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Patan Business and Professional Women - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Cheri Main

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheri Main M. lives in a single family home in Thecho with her husband, son and daughter. Thecho is located in the Lalitpur District. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Cheri's husband Mr. Hari Gopal M. is a farmer. He works his own land. Her son and daughter are in grade 11 in school.

Mrs. M. opened her own tailoring shop a year ago. She prefers to make custom fitted lady's dresses like kurta-salwar, blouses and other varities of lady's dresses in her shop. She took tailoring training from a local tailoring shop. Now she is asking for her third loan to buy clothes and one more sewing machine for her work. She spends all that she earns providing education for her son and daughter.

loans.use: To buy clothes and a sewing machine

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad lives in the south of Lebanon in the region of Saida with his family. He has eight children.

Ahmad has a pharmacy and needs to buy merchandise to sustain his business. This is the second time he will take a loan from Al Majmoua to buy inventory for his pharmacy. Ahmad is striving to support his family and has started in another job to generate more revenue to provide for his family. This loan will help him do that through the pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is a 57 year old tailor. This is the seventh time Mustafa is asking for a loan from Al Majmoua. Mustafa started with a $300 loan. The loans helped him buy business equipment and consequently generate more revenue from his tailoring business.

Mustafa lives in the south of Lebanon in the region of Saida. He manufactures children's clothing and cotton items. He needs this loan to buy raw material for his business and to pay the fees of fabric printing. Mustafa is a very hard working and honest man.

loans.use: To buy material for his work

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, a partner of Save the Children - Oct 26, 2008)

loans.name: Amani Brigitte

texts.en: Amani Brigitte lives with her family in Adjamé, a suburb in the north of the Abidjan district. Brigitte has 6 children, of whom 5 go to school. Brigitte's husband is a factory worker. She is a dynamic woman and is the economic and financial pillar of her family. She sells palm and groundnuts oils in the Adjamé market. She has been in this business for more than ten years. These products are very appreciated for both food preparation and traditional local cosmetic products. Brigitte will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk .

loans.use: Amani Brigitte will use the loan to purchase palm and groundnuts oils in bulk.

loans.name: Seyri

texts.en:
T. Seyri is from Sumgayit city of the Azerbaijan Republic. She is 56 years old, married and the mother of three children. She began her business with $200 in 2004. She started selling a small variety of baby clothes.

With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she could hardly earn enough money to meet her family's food and important consumption needs. She had difficulty covering other family needs for medication, clothes, school, etc.

In 2005, she added selling cups, tea pots, glasses and plates to her business. She wants to improve her business and increase the number of her clients and earn more income. Seyri needs $400 for expanding her business and to buy additional plates, cups, glasses and other sorts of goods assortments.

She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand her business. She hopes that this will further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional plates, cups, glasses and other sorts of goods assortments.

loans.name: Guerla

texts.en: Guerla B. is a 51-year-old widowed woman. She was left alone with her 5 children without resources when her husband died in 2003. Guerla is taking care of all her family members' life expenses from her crop products microbusiness. She sells various vegetables and crops in the Attecoubé market. Attecoubé is a populated suburb in the northwest of the Abidjan district. Guerla has been able to send three of her younger children to school. She joined AE&I's microcredit program in July 2004 and has received several loans that she has repaid in good manner. She will use this loan to purchase crop products for retail.

loans.use: Guerla Bambara will use the loan to purchase crop products for retail.

loans.name: Euralie Bouh

texts.en: Euralie M. is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and has 3 children. She lives with her family in Attecoubé, a populated suburb in the northwest of the Abidjan district. Euralie's husband is unemployed. Euralie sells various crop products such as palm grains and fish. She has been in this business for more than 10 years. Euralie's revenues from this business are actually the unique revenue resources of her family. She is very dynamic and an excellent performer. She takes cares of her 3 children, who are all going to school. She joined the AE&I microcredit program 2 years ago and has been able reimburse all her loans in a good manner.

loans.use: Euralie Bouh Makeu will use the loan to purchase stock of palm grains and grilled fish

loans.name: Bola

texts.en: Bola A. has 4 children and she is 37 years of age. He hails from a rural sector in Ijaniki, Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been a leader in a union under LAPO for the past 3 years. She sells cement in bags and has been in business since the year 2002. She is requesting for  $1175 to buy more bags of cements for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more bags of cement

loans.name: Olubanwo

texts.en: Mrs. Olubanwo E. is married with 2 children, she is 36 years old. She lives in Ijaniki, Lagos State of Nigeria. Olubanwo sells childrens' clothing in the Alaba International Market located 3 miles away from her home. She makes that distance every day to join her customers in the market. Olubanwo has many years of experience in  selling clothes for children. She has consistently developed her business over the last two years. She needs an additional loan of $800 to buy more clothing.

loans.use: To buy more children's clothing

loans.name: Bukola

texts.en: Bukola A. is 31 years old, married with 3 children. She has 7 years' experience in her business. She sells drinks and equally rents videos to people living in her community. Hence she is in need of $1175 to buy more drinks for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and videos

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Mrs. Janet O. is 34 years old, married with three (3) children and she lives in Agbara in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1997. She sells weavon and hair attachments. She needs the loan of $800 to buy more weavon, hair attachments and a refrigerator for selling drinks. This, she believes, will improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: I. Fumilayo is 32 years old, married with three children. A trained fashion designer. she said LAPO came to her aid in 2002 when she was in need of money to boast her fashion home. She has been a leader in a union under LAPO and lives in Ijaniki, a rural area of Lagos State. She needs a loan of $800 to buy more clothes and tailoring material for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and tailoring material

loans.name: Temitope

texts.en: Temitope B. is 27 years old. A single lady, she lives in a rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria where she has a hairdressing store and also sells cosmetics to people in her environment. She is a dedicated client of LAPO.  She needs the  $400 loan to enable her to buy more cosmetics for sale.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Bidemi

texts.en: Bidemi O. is 30 years of old, married with 3 children, hails from Ijaniki in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drugs. She has been in business since 1998. She needs the loan $400 to buy more drugs for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Ajose

texts.en: Ajose A. is 50 years old, married with 4 children, and lives in Ajose in Lagos. She has been with LAPO as a client for the past 3 years. She comes from a rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in business since 1970. She sells all types of baby items and needs the loan of $400 to buy these items for sale.

loans.use: To buy more baby items for sale

loans.name: Omolayo

texts.en: Omolayo J. is married with 2 children, 30 years of age and has been with LAPO for the past 3 years. She sells films, albums, frames. She is also a photographer. She has been in her business since 1996 and she needs the loan of $400 to buy more films, albums, frames for sale.

loans.use: To buy films, albums, frames and others

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo S. is a married mother with 2 children; she is 31 years of age and hails from Ibiye, a semi rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes. She has been in business since the year 2004. She hopes to get the loan of $800 to buy more clothes for sale.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Doris Margarita

texts.es:
Dora is a diligent mother who occupies herself by selling her products daily in the streets of Tarma. She sells door to door and offers products like detergents and Chinese medicines to other moms and women who keep house.

Although she is struggling with difficult circumstances due to her mother's poor health, she continues day to day with the sole purpose of covering their medical expenses and the general family expenses generated by her four sons. Nonetheless, she holds a small ray of light and hope in the fact that she and her husband work hard selling door to door each day in her city.

This loving mom wishes to increase her inventory in order to generate more business and income to cover her family's expenses. She would also like to save money in order to someday have a pretty house, which is currently just a dream of hers.

With your help she will be able to continue her responsibilities (as mother and daughter) and provide for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Dora, es una diligente madre de familia, que diariamente se ocupa de vertir sus productos en las calles de la ciudad de Tarma. Vende de manera ambulantemente, detergentes y medicamentos chinos para todas las reinas del hogar.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias de salud por las que atraviesa su querida madre, sigue esforzándose con el objetivo de cubrir los gastos médicos y hospitalarios, y a esto se suma los gastos familiares que generan sus cuatro hijos varones.

Sin embargo ella tiene un rayito de luz y esperanza en el ingreso económico que le genera la venta de la mercadería que junto a su esposo oferta por las calles de su ciudad diariamente, además de los pedidos de sus vecinos.

Debido a que el momento por el que atraviesa su familia es muy preocupante, para esta amorosa madre; desea incrementar el número de sus artículos para obtener aún mayores ingresos y costear cada uno de los requerimientos de su querida familia. También desea ahorrar con el sueño de tener una hermosa casa que aún sólo mantiene en su mente.

Con vuestra importante colaboración , ella, podrá seguir cumpliendo con sus dos importantes papeles (hija y madre) para la plena satisfacción de las necesidades que le demanda su hogar.

loans.use: Additional capital to increase products for sale

loans.name: Ruel Orris

texts.es:
Ruel Orris D. C. is a 43-year-old Creole small businessman from Bluefields. He has two children who are in secondary school. For the last ten years, Mr. D. has devoted himself to buying beef and pork and then smoking it in a rustic oven. This process adds value to the meat, which he can then sell at noted restaurants with whom he has an arrangement. Besides buying and smoking beef and pork, he also smokes venison and other meats as a service to others.  Since both meat consumption and orders increase toward the end of the year, Mr. D. needs a loan to purchase more meat. Each pound of pork costs $0.70 per pound, and each pound of beef costs $1.20 per pound. 

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer. 

Ruel Orris D. C. es un microempresario de la etnia creole, de 43 años de edad, originario de Bluefields, casado con dos hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en el nivel secundaria. El señor D. se dedica desde hace 10 años a comprar carne de res y cerdo y posteriormente con un horno rustico le hace el proceso de ahumado lo que le da un valor agregado a la carne y la vende a restaurantes reconocidos de esta ciudad con los que tiene compromiso de compra. Ademas de dedicarse a comprar y ahumar carne de res y de cerdo tambien si alguien quiere dar a ahumar carne de venado, guardtinajas y otros, el señor D. les ofrece ese servicio. Como el consumo de la carne se incrementa para finales de año, de igual forma los pedidos de las mismas se les ha incrementado al señor D., por lo que necesita un financiamiento para la compra de carne. Cada libra de carne de cerdo la compra a US$ 0.70 dolares y la carne de res a US$ 1.20 cada libra.

loans.use: Purchase of 200 lbs of pork and 100 lbs of beef

payments.comment: Su cuota es de US$ 43.33 esta es su segunda cuota, pago antes de tiempo.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Mrs. Alejandrina A. is a mother and is 58 years of age. She is brave, and despite her advancing years, she continues to show her immense diligent spirit through by working hard through all the financial hardships which have presented themselves in her life. She has been able to sustain some financial difficulties with the breeding and sale of some of her hens and roosters. She also provides laundry services for some paying customers and this has also been a help to her.

Currently she is helping the youngest of her 5 children, who is close to graduating from high school and very much wishes to continue his education by attending the small university in their city.

Her pace and hardwork, however, have taken its toll on Alejandrina's health and this is one reason why she would like to formally move her business to the market space in her town. Along with her rooster and hen sales, she'd like to incorporate the selling of some household items to the town's women.

With the help that your generous heart can offer, she'll be able to continue helping her youngest son and will also be able to take better care of her health.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Alejandrina A., es una valiente madre D. familia D. 58 años D. edad, que a pesar D. su avanzada edad sigue mostrando un inmenso espíritu diligente, con el que día a día hace frente a las duras condiciones económicas D. su realidad, a través D. la crianza y venta D. algunas gallinitas y cuyes. Asimismo lava la ropa D. algunas personas, que le pagan por este servicio con el único afán D. incrementar las perspectivas D. su hogar. A través D. su desempeño en estas actividades apoya al menor D. sus cinco hijos, quién está próximo a terminar su secundaria y tiene muchos deseos D. seguir una carrera universitaria en las aulas D. la pequeña universidad D. su ciudad. Su arduo desempeño ha perjudicado considerablemente la salud D. esta abnegada señora, por lo que desea enormemente poder tener un negocio en el mercado para dedicarse íntegramente a este espacio D. ventas, con el propósito D. ofertar sus artículos a las reinas del hogar que a diario visitan las instalaciones D. este lugar en busca D. artículos D. primera necesidad. Con el apoyo que vuestro generoso corazón le otorgue, podrá seguir apoyando a su menor hijo y también cuidará D. su salud D. una mejor manera.

loans.use: Loan will be used to rent a space where she can sell her products in her city's central market.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.en: Fatou D. is a 28-year-old woman. She has 3 children and lives with her cohabitant and their children  in Attecoubé, a populated suburb in the northwest of the Abidjan district. Fatou's cohabitant is a factory worker, and Fatou sells various women's beauty accessories such as costume jewelery, earrings, rings, bracelets, wristwatches, etc. Fatou has been in microbusiness for more than 10 years. Fatou wants to purchase goods in bulk in preparation for the year end celebration, which is a good business opportunity period for her. She has been in the AE&I microcredit program for more than 3 years. She is a very good performer.

loans.use: Fatou Doumbia will use the loan to purchase goods in bulk

loans.name: Ajao

texts.en:
Ajao R. is a dynamic man of 53 years. He is married and the father of 8 children. Ajao lives with his family in Attecoubé, a populated suburb in the northwest of the Abidjan district.. Ajao has been a butcher since he was 24 years old. Ajao's family is a happy family; all his children have been or are currently in school and are well educated. He considers sending all his children to school as a life challenge. Ajao does his business in the Attecoubé open market. He requests the loan  to purchase a couple of cows.
He has been in the AE&I microcredit program since June 2005 and has been an excellent performer since then.

loans.use: Ajao Rasaki will use the loan to purchase cows

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Doña Alejandrina, 48 years old, is an admirable family woman that has proven herself to be a hard-working lady and a fine weaver throughout her life . After completing her projects, she sells them in bulk in the capital city. Her new project is exporting her goods, and this encourages to her to devote more time to her weaving and to caring for her guinea pigs at home. She does all this without ever neglecting her housework or the needs of her three children. Hoping to improve their standard of living and to reach her exporting dreams, she wants to increase the number of woven items she has available. She requires raw materials for her works, such as threads and fabrics, so that her handiwork can be admired and purchased abroad. We’re counting on your generous support to make Alejandrina’s dreams a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Alejandrina D. 48 años, es una admirable madre D. familia, que en el transcurso D. su vida, se mostró siempre como una dama trabajadora y una muy buena tejedora D. tapetes, que al término D. su confección comercializa en gran cantidad en la ciudad capital D. su país.

El nuevo proyecto D. exportar sus artículos, la anima a seguir esforzándose y a dedicarle más tiempo a sus tejidos y al cuidado D. sus pequeños cuyes en casa, sin descuidar ni por un momento la atención D. su humilD. hogar y la demanda D. sus tres hijos.

Con el deseo D. incrementar su nivel D. vida y el D. alcanzar su sueño D. exportación desea incrementar el número D. sus tejidos. Y para lograr este objetivo requiere D. materiales D. confección (hilos, telas, etc). Con El propósito D. que la obra D. sus manos pueda ser admirada y comercializada en el extranjero.

Contamos con vuestra gentil contribución para hacer realidad los sueños D. Alejandrina.

loans.use: Purchase of fine materials to continue her lovely weaving.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Mrs. Luzmila, 43 years old, is a tireless woman who shows her optimistic spirit every day. With this spirit, she has been able to confront her family’s difficult economic situation with the sole goal of improving the health and quality of life of her household. She managed to open a small business in which she sells various toiletries and a wide variety of Omnilife products. This has enabled her to help her three children that still attend a school in the city. Their economic troubles have forced them to continue living with her aging mother, which has occasionally created inconveniences. That’s why her greatest desire is to have her own house for her beloved family. To do this, Luzmila wishes to increase the investment in her business so she can rely on a greater quantity of products and eventually build her little house on some land she owns. Let’s bring our support to Mrs. Luzmila so she can soon make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Luzmila de 43 años, es una incansable mujer, que a diario muestra un espíritu optimista con el que ha podido enfrentar las duras condiciones económicas de su familia, con el único fin de incrementar la salud y nivel de vida de su hogar. Logró abrir un pequeño negocio en el que expende diversos artículos de tocador y una gran variedad de productos Omnilife, esto le ha facultado la posibilidad de ayudar a sus 3 hijos, quienes aún estudian en un centro educativo de su ciudad.

La dificil situación los ha obligado ha permanecer cobijados en la casa de su anciana madre y este hecho muchas veces les ha traído múltiples incomodidades, por lo que su anhelo más grande es tener una casa propia para habitarla en compañía de su querida familia. Por ello, Luzmila, desea incrementar la inversión en su negocio para poder contar con una mayor cantidad de productos con el objetivo de construir su casita en un terreno que posee.

Brindémosle nuestro apoyo para que pronto pueda cristalizar sus anhelos.

loans.use: To acquire a greater quantity of goods to sell.

loans.name: Hermenegildo Javier

texts.es:
Mr. Javier H., as a young boy, always showed a great ability to build things, and then as a young man worked to refine his craft. With great effort he's turned into a great master builder.

With his hard work, he has been able to provide a good quality of life for his family and the benefit of education for their 5 children, who already have their own homes and share their sorrows and dreams outside the family.

And even now at 53 years old, he continues to work for his beloved wife, Luzmila, who recently had to undergo emergency surgery due to a problem with her uterus. This situation, coupled with his age, has also greatly affected his health. He had thought that planting coffee, which is experiencing a boom at present, would serve to bring in additional income, and would help with his wife's recovery expenses, as well as his own health concerns.

With your support we can help this married couple raise their quality of life and health and help them stay happy and healthy longer.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Don Javier H., mostró siempre desde niño una gran habilidad para la construcción, ya de joven se esforzó para perfeccionarla y con mucho esfuerzo llegó a convertirse en un gran maestro constructor. Con esta actividad durante mucho tiempo les ha otorgado a los miembros de su familia una buena calidad de vida y educación a sus cinco hijos, quienes ya tienen sus propios hogares y comparten sus penas y anhelos fuera del seno familiar. Sin embargo aún a sus 53 años, continúa esforzándose por su amada esposa, Luzmila, quién recientemente tuvo que ser operada de urgencia por un problema en el útero. Toda esta realidad sumada a su edad, ha perjudicado grandemente su propia salud. Por lo que ha pensado incursionar en el cultivo del café, que está teniendo un gran auge en la actualidad. Este nuevo reto le permitirá solventar los gastos de recuperación de su esposa y asimismo le ayudará a incrementar el nivel de su salud. Con vuestro importante apoyo podremos ayudar a esta trabajadora pareja de esposos a incrementar su calidad de vida y salud para que permanezcan juntos por mucho tiempo más.

loans.use:
Additional capital in order to start a new business.

Inyección de capital para iniciar un nuevo negocio.

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Mrs. Norma Ramirez is 30 years old and is a hard working mother, we can find her working tirelessly in her father's restaurant, where she shows a great talent for cooking and where her plates are always a delight to her customers. She works very hard because of her great love for her two small children, who are a source of motivation and drive. One year ago, her husband passed away in a terrible accident, an event which pained her deeply. Nevertheless, she has never allowed her optimism to fail her and continues working with the goal of creating a better life for her family. Today, she desires to invest in the restaurant in order to save money, with the end goal of opening her own point of sales from her modest home. This will help her to support her children and to be able to have more time with them. We make this request (for a loan) in order to offer her children a better standard of living and education.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Norma R. de 30 años de edad, es una laboriosa madre de familia, a la que encontramos trabajando incansablemente en el restaurante de su papá, donde muestra su gran habilidad para la cocina, siendo sus platos un deleite para sus clientes. Ella se esfuerza mucho por el gran amor que posee por sus dos pequeños hijos, quienes son su fuente de motivación y de ánimo. Pues hace un año su esposo falleció en un terrible accidente que le causó un gran dolor; sin embargo no ha hecho decaer su optimismo y sigue esforzándose con el objetivo de ver mejor a su familia. Ahora desea implementar el restaurante para ahorrar un poco de dinero con el propósito de aperturar pronto su propio local de ventas en su modesta casa, con el fin de seguir apoyando a sus menores hijos y así estar mayor tiempo con ellos. Posibilitemos esta petición para que pueda brindarle a sus pequeños un mejor nivel de vida y educación.

loans.use: Investing in a small restaurant.

loans.name: Cynder Gael

texts.es:
Mrs. Cynder M. is 30 years old and the mother of 3 children, all of whom study and for whom Mrs. M. work tirelessly selling foods from a Kiosk that is rented in the center of the city. Mrs. M. separated from her husband not long ago and decided that she would become the head of the household. Despite her hard reality, she has succeeded; motived by her immense love as a mother. Many people enjoy her excellent seasonings and her great variety of plates she offers thanks to her culinary skills. Nevertheless, the rent for the kiosk is much more than the normal going rate and cuts into her earnings she works so hard for on a daily basis. Today she wishes to expand her business and to purchase her own kiosk so that she will not have to pay rent, and in which way she will be able to continue to give unconditional support to her children as well as continuing to delight her loyal customers. Your contribution can make this dream a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La señora Cynder M. de 30 años de edad, es madre de 3 hijos, los cuales son estudiantes y trabaja incansablemente vendiendo comida en un kiosco que alquila en el centro de su ciudad ya que se separó de su esposo hace un tiempo y decidió llevar las riendas de su hogar sola.A pesar de esta dura realidad ha salido adelante, motivada por el inmenso amor de madre que posee y es así que muchas personas disfrutan de su excelente sazón y gran variedad de platos gracias a sus habilidades culinarias, sin embargo el alquiler del kiosco muchas veces merma considerablemente los ingresos que diariamente se esfuerza por conseguir.Hoy anhela grandemente adquirir su propio kiosco para no tener que pagar un alquiler, de tal manera que pueda seguir siendo aquél apoyo incondicional para sus hijos y asimismo pueda seguir siendo el deleite de sus comensales.Vuestra contribución posibilitará este hecho.

loans.use: To purchase a vending space to increase earnings.

loans.name: Roda Luz

texts.es:
We find Roda Ramirez working diligently in her small store, in which she happily displays the diversity of her products, primarily those of basic needs (groceries, cleaning supplies, health products, etc.) She and her adored husband rent a their store space in a local commercial zone, and as the number of people near their own home is relatively low, it was not conducive to having a store in their own neighborhood. The rent for this store space has increased over time and has cut into their earnings considerably. And so, the family would like to increase the quantity of their products to increase their earnings. In this way, they could continue to pay rent for their store space and also save enough money to purchase their own store space in the future. Their ultimate goal is to give a better standard of life to their small son. Help us support this woman in her search for happiness.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Encontramos a Roda Ramirez enfrascada diligentemente en su pequeña bodega, en el que expende animosamente diversidad de productos de primera necesidad (abarrotes, artículos de limpieza, de salud, etc.)Ella y su querido esposo alquilan el local de su bodega en una zona comercial, ya que la afluencia de público por su vivienda es relativamente baja, lo que no permitiría tener un negocio de estas características en su casa. El pago por este alquiler con el tiempo se ha incrementado poco a poco y muchas veces este pago merma considerablemente sus ingresos, por lo que esta familia desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos para aumentar sus ganancias.De esta manera podrán seguir pagando el alquiler de su local y ahorrar un poco de dinero para seguir proyectándose en el futuro a tener un local propio con el objetivo de seguir brindándole lo mejor a su pequeño niño.Ayudemos a esta mujer en la búsqueda de su felicidad.

loans.use: Investment to expand the quantity and variety of her products.

loans.name: Lucio Sabino

texts.es:
We found Lucio, master builder, working hard in building a shelter, where he works each day, surrounded by cement, sand and bricks, to provide a better future for his family, with much effort and sacrifice. After working at construction daily, he goes and works in a small farm and tends to the plantain crop with the help of his beloved wife. Lucio learned agricultural work from an early age, when he used to spend time in the jungle and as a young man rented a small house on the land. Lucio would like to put greater investment in the plantain production, in order to earn more income and start a clothing retail business, with his wife, so that hopefully they can begin to save money. His ultimate dream is to purchase a plot of land in which he can begin construction of their own home, where he and his family can share moments of happiness. With hopes and dreams of establishing his own sweet home, he asks for your help and contribution.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a Lucio, maestro de obras, trabajando animosamente en la construcción de una vivienda, donde sumergido entre cemento, arena y ladrillos, forja día a día un futuro mejor para su familia, a través de su esfuerzo y sacrificio. Cuando acaba su labor como constructor, presuroso se interna en su pequeña chacra para cuidar sus platanales con ayuda de su querida esposa.Él aprendió las labores agrícolas desde que empezó a radicar en la selva, mostrando gran habilidad y destreza, por lo cual se quedó a radicar allí alquilando una casa. Lucio desea tener una mayor inversión de dinero en la producción de plátanos para iniciar un negocio de comercialización de ropa, junto a su esposa, con lo cual podrán empezar a ahorrar dinero. Para comprar un terreno, en el cual Lucio pueda iniciar la construcción de su casa, de manera que junto a su familia pueda compartir momentos de alegría.Con el anhelo de establecerse en un dulce hogar recurre a vuestra generosa ayuda y contribución.

loans.use: Additional capital in order to continue growing exquisite plantain crop and expand production. (Inyección de capital para seguir produciendo exquisitos plátanos en su pequeña chacra.)

loans.name: Georgina Casilla

texts.en: Georgina is a single woman with no children living in San Cristobal in the Dominican Republic.  She sells a variety of home furnishing fabrics, including tablecloths, curtains, and bed sheets.  In addition to being her primary source of income, her craft is something in which she takes tremendous personal enjoyment and pride. Georgina plans on investing in new textiles and cloth with her loan, so she can vary the kinds of products she fashions.

loans.use: Purchase of new fabrics for decorative home furnishings

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.en: Ana Josefa is a single mother  living in San Cristobal whose four children, two boys and two girls, range from eleven to twenty-three years old.  Ana Josefa sells new and used women’s clothing to support her family.  Most entrepreneurial clothing vendors in Ana’s area purchase clothing from outside of the community for resale locally.  Ana obtains some of her merchandise the same way, but also pays a nominal fee for the used clothing of her friends and family members and resells these items.  She also plans to use her loan to buy more new clothing at less expensive bulk rates to improve her profit margin.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing at bulk rates.

loans.name: Belquis María

texts.en:
Belquis is a 34 years old woman with three children  living in Yamasa in the Dominican Republic.  Her husband is living outside of the country.  Her children, two girls and a boy, attend a private school.  Five years ago, Belquis decided to open a small store in her house, since external remittances income from her husband could not always help her face the housing issues.  In her store, she sells T-shirts, shirts, underwear and jeans for men and women.  She also sells beauty products like hair treatment lotion, hair dying products, and other goods for skin care.  Generally, she gets the merchandise in Santo Domingo, the capital, from an importer.
Belquis is requesting a loan to purchase clothing in bulk, women’s perfumes and accessories to supply her store.  The profits from the sale will help her to continuing providing for her family.

loans.use: The loan will be used to buy perfumes, underwear and other women's accesories to supply the entrepreneur's business.

loans.name: Crecencia Beltran

texts.en: Crecencia sells new women’s clothing and beauty products from her home in the Nigua community of San Cristobal.  Her son and daughter are twins, now fully grown in their forties.  Crecencia has become increasingly aware of the number of entrepreneurs in her area who specialize in women’s beauty items.  As a result, Crecencia will use her loan to purchase clothing, makeup, and personal care merchandise that she believes her competitors do not offer.  She hopes the new products will ensure her business’s continued growth.

loans.use: The purchase of new clothing, makeup, and women's beauty products.

loans.name: Arelis Pérez

texts.en: Arelis, 36, is married and has three children (two boys and a girl) and lives in Yamasa, Dominican Republic.  They attend public school.  Her husband is working as bartender in Santo Domingo, the capital.  For more than two years, Arelis has been running a small business within her house.  She sells clothes, shoes, slippers, trainers and sandals for women.  Bi-monthly, she goes to the capital to purchase the goods and resells in her community.  Sometimes, she sells door to door.  Her persistence and persuasive speaking abilities have earned her many loyal customers.  Now, Arelis is thinking about increasing her sales volume considerably and expanding her client base.  She needs a loan to buy of products in bulk so that she can reduce costs and increase profit.  She will use a part of the loan to buy a new showcase to put the products.

loans.use: The purchase off clothing and shoes in bulk

loans.name: Eunice Besaida

texts.en: Eunice is fifty-seven years old and a mother of five children, two sons and three daughters, all of whom are above the age of thirty.  Since the death of her husband two years ago, Eunice has supported herself by selling a variety of domestic products to other women in her small community in the Dominican Republic’s San Cristobal province.  Currently, Eunice sells shampoo, perfume, hair care, and hygiene items but she hopes that she can expand her inventory to include women’s slippers and other clothing items after receiving her loan.  She explains that, “with God’s blessing,” the new items will help expand her business and attract new customers.

loans.use: To add women's slippers and other clothing items to inventory of beauty and personal care products

loans.name: Minelva Brito

texts.en:
Minelva is a 39-year-old married woman living with her husband and four children.  The eldest recently began university studies.  The others go to the public school.  Her husband is a teacher and works for a private college.
Shortly after her marriage fifteen years ago, Minelva opened a business with her husband’s help.  She retails clothes that she buys in bulk in Santo Domingo or La Romana, a province located on the southeastern coast of the Dominican Republic.  Minelva has a very well established clientele.  But like any visionary entrepreneur, Minelva wants to grow her business and become one of most known and profitable businesses in the township.  She needs funds to buy larger amounts of clothing in bulk so that she can sell more.  She also is thinking about saving money in order to have an own local (market stand) where she can operate her sales activity.  Minelva is very positive and thinks that she fulfill her dreams if she keeps working hard and being persistent.

loans.use: To buy clothing in bulk and to save money  to have a local soon.

loans.name: Rosa Irene

texts.en: Rosa is married and her three sons, fifteen, sixteen, and nineteen, all attend school, thanks in part to the aromatic candles and tablecloths their mother crafts at home.  Rosa’s business is particularly unique because it offers both an array of goods she produces by hand and manufactured items she brings to market.  Rosa also sells a variety of women’s clothing.  She plans to begin selling men’s clothing, including pants and collared shirts soon and hopes to someday sell her merchandise from her own store instead of her home.  With her loan, Rosa would purchase men's and women’s clothing in bulk, securing a better rate for the merchandise and limiting the number of trips she will have to make outside of her community to buy the items.

loans.use: Purchase of new merchandise, including men's clothing, at bulk rates

loans.name: Gollita

texts.en: Gollita is a hard-working, persistent and a very experienced businesswoman.  For more than fifteen years, she has been running a discotheque in Monte Plata.  Her discotheque is very well-located, so it is very often visited by locals.  Gollita operates the business only on week-ends and on holidays.  Every week she has to incur in the purchase beverages such as beer, rum and whiskey.  Running the discotheque has been very useful for her and her family.  In fact, with the income from the discotheque, she pays the university studies of her only 22-year-old daughter.  She also helps her husband (a technician that fixes radios and TVs) face other housing issues. Gollita is requesting a loan to buy more drinks for her business.  She will also buy new beverages to diversify her offerings to the customers and better satisfy their needs.

loans.use: To buy drinks as beer, whiskey, rum and new ones to supply the entrepreneur's discotheque.

loans.name: Irsa Mendez

texts.en: Irsa is a forty-one year old single mother with two children.  She is the only entrepreneur in her community who specializes in designing pieces for decorating furniture, including shams and other coverings.  She began her textile business three years ago to support her two children.  Her son is seventeen years old and her daughter, who will soon start school, is six years old.  With her loan, Irsa plans to purchase a new weaving loom for her fabrics.  She hopes that someday the textile work she does in her home will become her “own company.”

loans.use: Investment in a new weaving loom.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en: María Del Carmen is 53 years old and has 6 children.  She has been married for just four years, even though she had been living with her partner and the couple had already had the children.  The children go to the university and the youngest attend public school.  María’s husband is working as a teacher.  Four years ago, shortly after her marriage, she started a small store, selling shoes and clothes.  She gets the merchandise in Santo Domingo and resells them in Monte Plata.  María thinks that she could do much better if she could get capital to grow her business.  She wants to buy bulk clothing and shoes and also to introduce cosmetics in the business.  She is requesting a loan to increase her sales volume, attract new people and continue improving her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk and shoes so as to increase her sales volume and attract new clients

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angelica Q. es an entreprising woman who day after day finds herself submerged in the sale and commercialization of delicious cheeses which she sells to the public. This work has allowed her to begin a second business selling clothing items, even though the quantities may be limited. The great welcome that he has received for her job performance in this commercial activity has enticed her to increase the quantity of products that she sells, with the end goal of improving her family's standard of living. Nevertheless, these goals are only wishes and cannot be realized without the support of such kind and generous hearts as yours. Help us to support this noble woman to fulfill her goals for her gratifying business.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Angélica Q., es una mujer emprendedora que día a día se encuentra sumida íntegramente en la venta y comercialización de deliciosos quesos que muy diligentemente expende al público, este esfuerzo le ha permitido iniciar también el negocio de la venta de ropa, aunque en una cantidad limitada.La gran acogida que ha obtenido por su desempeño en esta actividad le ha generado el deseo de incrementar la cantidad de productos que comercializa con el fin de elevar su nivel de vida familiar.Sin embargo estas metas anheladas no serán realizables sin el apoyo incondicional de corazones generosos como el de vosotros.Ayudemos a esta noble mujer a consolidar este gratificante negocio.

loans.use: An increase in earnings in the second job that this devoted mother works.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Pampanichi is a city splashed with the bright colors of Paulina C.'s handbags. Day after day, she pours her experience and creativity into making these bags, which she sends to Pampanichi weekly to be sold. Paulina also has great talent preparing flavorful, high-quality traditional dishes, a talent that brings her family lots of joy during times of celebration. She has thought of integrating traditional plates into the sales at her store, but the project demands a large investment in more materials, in addition to a small sewing machine to increase bag production and revenue. With her earnings, she will be able to realize her project goals to be able to continue providing for her grandson who lives with her. Since Paulina’s separation 7 years ago, her grandson has brought much joy to her free time. She is asking for your support so that she can keep making her beautiful bags.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

Pampanichi es una ciudad que ve dibujada su atmósfera D. vistosas bolsitas coloridas gracias a que Paulina C., día a día enfrascada en su taller D. textiles vierte toda su experiencia y creatividad para la generación D. estas bolsitas; las cuales envía a Pampanichi semanalmente para su venta.Paulina también posee una excelente sazón y calidad en la preparación D. platos típicos, que son infaltables durante las temporadas D. celebración para el deleite D. todos sus familiares. Ha pensado incursionar en la venta D. comida típica en su localidad, pero el proyecto le demanda una gran inversión por lo que desea comprar una mayor cantidad D. materiales, además D. una maquinita remalladora para una mayor producción D. bolsas y un mayor ingreso económico.Con el dinero que obtendrá D. este trabajo podrá empezar a concretar su anhelado proyecto para así seguir apoyando a su nieto, quién vive con ella y se ha convertido en una gran alegría en sus momentos libres, ya que es separada desD. hace 7 años.Solicita vuestro apoyo para poner en marcha la confección D. bellas bolsitas.

loans.use: Purchase of materials for making beautiful handbags.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Meals in Murinaki are always delicious, thanks to the great tasting Unión brand products on the table. Elvira C. puts them there day after day without fail. She has worked selling these products for a long time, and this job has allowed her to pay for school; all of her hard work has allowed her to help her children and succeed in her studies. The upcoming Christmas season can be a great opportunity for Elvira, especially because of the increased demand for panetones, traditional holiday cakes, throughout the city. Therefore, she would like to bring a large number of them to the Murinaki community, and, with her characteristic friendliness, sell them. With this new group of products she will continue to help and support her children whom she loves so much. Reach out to this mother who studied to become a professional and now wants the same for her children. You can help.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer

Las comidas en Murinaki son placenteras y muy deliciosas todos los días, debido a la presencia de los deliciosos productos de la fabrica unión en las mesas, ya que Elvira C. se encarga de llevarlos infaltablemente día a día. Ella se dedica a la venta de estos productos desde hace mucho tiempo y le ha permitido solventar sus estudios como docente durante mucho tiempo y ahora con su desempeño puede ayudar a sus hijos, también en su superación académica.La próxima campaña navideña se deslumbra como una oportunidad muy grande para Elvira, debido a la gran demanda de panetones en la ciudad, por lo que desea traer una gran cantidad de estos a la pequeña comunidad de Murinaki y así con la misma amabilidad que la caracteriza desde siempre los comercializará.Con este nuevo grupo de productos seguirá ayudando y contribuyendo con sus hijos a quienes ama mucho.Ayudemos a esta madre que estudió para ser profesional y ahora desea lo mismo para sus hijos y usted puede ayudar.

loans.use: Puchase of panettones to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Luci Natalia

texts.es:
In Pichanaki you will find very beautiful and eye-catching handbags that have been in high demand among tourists in the city. They are the work of Lucila C., a woman that pours her creativity and effort into every work. These bags are so popular that selling them has become a huge business; for this reason, she has decided to try to export them. However, she knows that realizing this dream requires greater investment and production, as well as improved quality of her materials, and all of this has put her dream on hold in the past. Through hard work and ambition she would like to continue supporting her children after a terrible separation. This is why she is asking for kind people to fund her projects and dreams with a loan. She will use it to carry out her plans and reach her goal of continuing to proviD. for her family. Help this entrepreneur keep moving forward and begin exporting her products.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

En Pichanaki podemos encontrar unas bolsas muy llamativas y hermosas, que son muy apreciadas y demandadas por los turistas que constantemente visitan la ciudad, esta realidad es gracias a que Lucila C., pone en cada creación suya todo su arte y esfuerzo.Estos bolsos tan apreciados se han convertido en su gran negocio por lo que se ha propuesto la meta D. exportarlos, sin embargó para que este sueño se haga realidad requiere D. una mayor inversión y productividad; también una mejora en la calidad D. los materiales e insumos. Todo esto ha frenado muchas veces este anhelo en ella. Con su esfuerzo e ímpetu diario desea seguir apoyando a los pequeños que se quedaron con ella luego D. una terrible y penosa separación.Es por ello que solicita el apoyo D. corazones afables para financiar sus proyectos y sueños, a través D. un préstamo, con los que realizará esto planes con la meta D. seguir siendo el sostén D. su hogar.Ayudemos a una dama emprendedora y apoyémosla a seguir adelante y a exportar sus productos.

loans.use: Purchase of materials to continue making beautiful handbags.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
For a long time, Elizabeth Olaguibel and her husband Caleb have been working together selling a series of products. Because they have a small car, they have been able to earn some extra money on top of sales by delivering their neighbors’ orders to their homes. When they are not concentrating on this line of work, Elizabeth also raises chickens and, more importantly, sells clothing for little girls. A mother of eight, this extra income has allowed her to help with her large family's expenses. Because clothing sales have been quite good this season, Elizabeth wishes to integrate clothing of all kind into her sales so that her children can successfully complete their studies. To realize this goal, she needs a larger capital investment, and she kindly asks you for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth Olaguibel y su esposo Caleb, trabajan desD. hace mucho tiempo juntos comercializando diversos productos, gracias a un pequeño auto que ellos poseen, percibiendo además D. los ingresos D. la venta un dinero adicional por llevar los encargos D. sus vecinos a sus familiares.Durante el tiempo en el que no están inmersos en estas actividades, Elizabeth se dedica a la crianza D. algunas gallinitas, pero sobre todo a la venta D. prendas D. vestir para niñas; lo que le ha permitido tener algunos ingresos extras para contribuir con los gastos que genera su numerosa familia, ya que posee 8 hijos.La venta D. ropas para niñas ha sido muy buena en esta temporada por lo que Elizabeth desea incursionar en la venta D. prendas D. vestir para todo género con el propósito D. que sus hijos puedan concluir sus estudios superiores satisfactoriamente.Para cumplir esta meta, es necesario una mayor inversión en el capital D. inversión, por lo que solicita vuestro generoso aporte.

loans.use: Capital investment to increase the variety of articles of clothing offered.

loans.name: Rosmery Leonor

texts.en:
Here we see Ms. Rosmery L. in her Keyla Beauty Salon, showing us a sample of her great ability and skill as cosmetologist. Because of her skill, she has generated a lot of clients, and thanks to this effort she has also been able to open a small grocery store in her home, where she passes time when not immersed in the demands of the beauty shop. The limited space of her beauty parlor, the large number of clients and above all the many needs of her children, has created the desire to change the current location of the salon that she runs to expand and implement it in a better way, so she can continue providing full support and love to her two children of 12 and 7 years (she is the sole breadwinner as a single mother). Conducting these projects demands a greater investment, therefore, she is appealing to your generous hearts in asking for a loan. With this loan, and your help, she'll begin to turn her desires into a working reality and in turn benefit the happiness of her two small treasures.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Encontramos a la señora Rosmery L. en su salón de belleza Keyla, acabando una muestra de su gran capacidad y habilidad como cosmetóloga, destreza que le ha generado acopiar una gran cantidad de clientas; gracias a este esfuerzo pudo abrir una bodega en casa en la cual pasa el tiempo cuando no está sumergida en las demandas del salón de belleza.El reducido espacio de su salón de belleza, el gran número de clientes y sobretodo las múltiples necesidades de sus hijos, han generado en ella el deseo de modificar el actual local del salón que posee y ampliarlo e implementarlo de una mejor manera, para así seguir brindándoles todo el apoyo y afecto a sus dos menores hijos de 12 y 7 años, de los cuales ella es el único sostén, por ser madre soltera.La realización de estos proyectos demanda una mayor inversión por lo que apela a vuestros generosos corazones solidarios, solicitando un préstamo, con el que empezará a estructurar estos anhelos para seguir trabajando en la realización de la felicidad de sus dos pequeños tesoros. A los cuales usted también puede ayudar recuérdelo.

loans.use: Implementation of a small area for her beauty salon services. (Adecuación e implementación del pequeño espacio de belleza.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of beans, rice, vegetables and other goods

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Fundación San Miguel Arcángel, Inc. (FSMA) - Oct 24, 2008)

loans.name: Gabino Sarmiento

texts.es:
Gabino is a son who has worked every day in his potato farm, and has now learned the craft of masonry. He accomplished this to offer the best to his beloved and elderly mother, because he wants to thank her for her hard work and effort caring for him throughout his life. He still hopes that one day he will be able to set up his own family and have children and be able to see them grow up to share all his joys and sorrows. At this age, however, his dream seems difficult to accomplish. Nothing is more beautiful than to build a family, and he has focused his parental love on his small nephews who sometimes come to fill his home with joy and dispel his loneliness. Today, he asks for your support in order to be able to purchase fertilizers to improve his crops, to be able to purchase expensive medicines for his mother and help his nephews. We count on your help so that Gabino can contribute to his loved ones every day.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Gabino, es un hijo que día a día ha trabajado en su chacra sembrando papa y ahora ha aprendido el oficio de albañil, para poder ofrecerle lo mejor a su querida y anciana madre; porque desea agradecerle con su esfuerzo todo el empeño y cuidados que le dedicó cuando era muy pequeño.A pesar de tener el cariño de su madre no deja de anhelar el objetivo de constituir una familia y tener hijos a los cuales pueda ver crecer para compartir sus momentos de alegrías y tristezas, pero a su edad le es un sueño difícil de realizar.Nada es más hermoso que construir y formar una familia, pero volcó todo ese amor paternal en sus pequeños sobrinos que en ocasiones vienen a llenar de alegría y disipar la soledad de la casa.A pesar de sus frustrados sueños le queda el cariño de su tierna madre y el calor de sus sobrinos, los cuales son su motor para poder salir adelante y ofrecerles lo poco que puede tener.Hoy requiere de vuestro apoyo para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes a fin de mejorar sus productos para alcanzar a comprar las costosas medicinas de su madre.Contamos con su colaboración para que Gabino pueda contribuir con la alegría que sus seres queridos le brindan día tras día.

loans.use:
Purchase of fertilizers to improve his harvest. 
(Compra de abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar su cosecha.)

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Business Description

Yessica has 3 years of experience running her business. She began with the help of a family member who encouraged her to begin selling these products. She works daily from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. She has earned a loyal clientele in the small amount of time she has been in business which have helped increase her earnings. She offers home delivery of her products as well as selling them from her storefront.

Use of Loan

The loan will be used to invest in additional merchandise for her business. The time of year is fast approaching in which she receives requests for specific products.

Personal Information

Yessica is a single mother. Her son is 3 years old. She lives with her In-Laws who provide her with all the support she needs. The home in which she lives is of mixed construction (cement and wood). Her goal is to grow her business and comfortably provide for her son.

:

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

Yessica tiene una experiencia de 3 años con su actividad. Se inicio con la ayuda de un familiar la cual la incentivo para la venta de estos productos. Trabaja todos los días de la semana en horario de 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m. Ha logrado en poco tiempo tener buenos clientes que han hecho que su capital crezca. Ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y en su domicilio.

Uso del Préstamo

El crédito lo invertirá en surtir su negocio con mercadería. Se viene la temporada buena donde tiene pedidos.

Información Personal

Yessica es madre soltera. Tiene un hijo de 3 años. Vive con sus suegros los cuales le dan todo el apoyo que ella necesita. La casa donde vive es de construcción mixta. Su meta es poder llegar a crecer en su negocio y darle todas las comodidades a su hijo.

loans.use:
Purchase additional merchandise

Comprar mas mercaderia

loans.name: Elizabeth Gladys

texts.es:
Elizabeth, from the time she was a very young girl dreamed of working sowing crops on her mother's land and spreading the word of God. That dream is now realized and thanks to her hard work and dedication she can enjoy her crops without neglecting the duty that she chose. She has so far been able to increase the amount of her crops, but now launched a new project that is very difficult to do without your help - to open a shop in her home to cover her home's expenses so that so that she can preach God's word to highly populated areas nearby. Her purpose is so that her beloved family can sustain their expenses while she is gone. To this end it has been suggested that she sow more seeds, and bring better products to the local market at a very good price. Help a struggling woman continue sowing her products and the word of God, and help her have a store which will enable her to continue helping others.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Elizabeth, desde muy niña soñó con trabajar sembrando en las tierras de su madre y llevando la palabra de Dios, sueño que ahora se consolidó y gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación puede disfrutar de sus cosechas sin descuidar el deber que decidió escoger. Ella hasta ahora ha podido incrementar la cantidad de sus cosechas, pero ahora se suscitó un nuevo proyecto que es muy difícil de realizar sin vuestra ayuda, el aperturar una tienda en su casa para solventar los gastos de su hogar, para que ella pueda marcharse a predicar la palabra de Dios a poblados muy lejanos.Su propósito es dejarla muy bien surtida para que su querida familia pueda sustentar sus gastos mientras ella se encuentra ausente. Y para este fin se ha propuesto esta temporada sembrar más productos con mejores semillas a fin de comercializarlos a muy buen precio en el mercado local para concretar su sueño. Apoyemos a una mujer que lucha para seguir sembrando sus productos y la palabra de Dios y tener esa tienda que le ayudará a ayudar

loans.use: To buy seeds to improve the planting and harvesting of her small plot of farm land. (Compra de semillas para mejorar la siembra y cosecha de su pequeña parcela de cultivo.)

loans.name: Hugo Vidal

texts.es:
Hugo is a hardworking man, who until now has been able to give the best to his family based on many sacrifices and constant work.
