Each day, in the very early hours, he leaves his home and devotes himself to caring and feeding of the animals he breeds. He also works cultivating a plot of land. His selfless wife cares for their small children along with their guinea pigs, and at midday carries out food to her husband and their children who help him with agricultural work. This is why he'd like to greatly increase their production of crops, so the children can focus on their studies without any problems. He asks you to help him be able to plant a large quantity of potatoes and corn and improve the breed and raising of his animales. Do not be indifferent to the need of this family, and if you can help, do not hesitate. Hugo hopes for your help to continue educating their children.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Hugo, es un hombre luchador que hasta hoy ha podido darle lo mejor a su familia a base de muchas madrugadas y de constantes días de trabajo, razón por la cual todos los días desde muy tempranas horas abandona su hogar para dedicarse a cuidar y a alimentar a sus animalitos que cría dentro de su hogar, además de la parcela de tierra que cultiva mientras estos buscan su alimento en las alturas.Su abnegada esposa se queda al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos y al cuidado de sus cuyes y a medio día sale a llevar los alimentos a su esposo, y a sus hijos que colaboran con las labores agrícolas de su padre, motivo por la cual desea enormemente acrecentar su producción para que ellos puedan estudiar sin ningún problema y solicita vuestra ayuda para que pueda sembrar un gran cantidad de papa, maíz y mejorar la raza de sus animales.No seamos indiferentes ante la necesidad de esta familia y si tú puedes colaborar no lo dudes Hugo espera tu ayuda para seguir educando a sus hijos

loans.use:
To purchase seeds and better animal food in order to improve the quality of his breed of small animals.  
(Compra de semillas y alimento para mejorar la raza de sus pequeños animales.)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Elizabeth is a strong woman who happily works hard. She grows and harvests corn, baby in arms, and his presence makes her work much more pleasant. Elizabeth loves her 5 children and does all she can to give them an education and meet their basic needs. A little while ago, bad luck struck her home: her daughter's epilepsy became more apparent, and the price of her daughter's medications has called Elizabeth to work even harder. Therefore, to help her children, she is asking for a loan to improve the harvests and the amount of maiz she grows. You can help keep this family a happy and close one, reach out to her so her children's smiles never leave their faces.

Translated from Spanish by Joanne Egnatchik, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Elizabeth, es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que trabaja muy alegremente. Se dedica a sembrar y cosechar maíz con su hijo en brazos, hecho que torna más placentero su trabajo.Tiene 5 hijos los cuales son su adoración y les brinda todo cuanto pueda tener para educarlos y satisfacer sus necesidades básicas.Hace poco la desgracia invadió su dulce hogar y la epilepsia que aqueja a su hijo mayor se hizo presente, el alto costo de los medicamentos los obliga a esforzarse aún más.Es por eso que pide y solicita un préstamo que le ayude a mejorar sus cosechas e incrementar sus siembras de maíz para obtener mayores ingresos en beneficio de sus hijos.Tú puedes hacer que esta familia siga viviendo tan feliz y unida como hasta ahora, colabore con su petición para que la sonrisa de sus miembros no se vaya. .

loans.use:
Purchase of more seeds to improve the harvest.

Compra de mayor cantidad de semillas para acrecentar el numero de productos durante la cosecha.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Improver her restaurants products

loans.name: Rosalía

texts.en:
Rosalia has a store which she has owned for about eight years. She started her business with money she had saved up and the help of a loan from a family member. Initially, she sold a variety of items ranging from rice to snacks. She saw opportunities to expand her business into a general store by increasing her line of offerings.

Consequently, Rosalia took out a loan with Mifex and Kiva to purchase school supplies, fashion accessories and novelty gifts. This resulted in greater sales and profits for her especially with school supplies since the school year was beginning at that time.

This business is a very important part of Rosalia’s household. Although her husband works hard as a door-to-door salesman of goods, Rosalia must rely on her store in order to cover the basic expenses. She works daily from 6AM to 10PM. She has three children who are in school. With Christmas on the way, Rosalia would like to invest in holiday decorations and gifts but she lacks the working capital to do so.

Rosalia is requesting a second loan so she may purchase those products now while prices are still low. In this manner, she can offer a decent price to her clients while still making a profit herself. Rosalia’s dream is to make more improvement to her home and provide a better future for her family.

loans.use: To invest in Christmas decorations and items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the interior appearance of her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To diversify her product offerings

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To finish his home and purchase shelves for his business

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
My construction work seems never-ending and I would like to finish it to be able to live in the rooms. I have already been delayed because of a lack of money but the cold and wet season is approaching and I am worried that my family will be uncomfortable because of the little space that we have. I am asking for a loan of $1,000.00 to finish the construction work on my house.

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar y me gustaría terminarla para poder habitar esos cuartos, ya que me he tardado un poco debído a la falta de dinero pero se acerca la temporada de lluvias y de frío así es que me preocupa que mi familia este incómoda debido al poco espacio que tenemos" Solicito $ 1,000.00 dlls para terminar la construcción de mi vivienda

loans.use: To finish construction work on my house

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es:
I have cement flooring in my house and would like to install tile flooring because it is easier to clean and is more hygenic for my family. I also need to plaster my walls to protect us in cold weather. I am asking for a loan of $700.00 to install flooring and plaster the walls in my house.

“Tengo piso de cemento en mi casa y me gustaría poner vitropiso ya que se puede limpiar mejor y es mas higiénico para mi familia, también necesito enjarrar las paredes para protegernos en tiempo de frío”. Solicito $ 700.00 dlls para la poner el vitropiso en mi casa y enjarrar las paredes.

loans.use: To put in flooring and plaster the walls

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in fabric and an industrial sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy merchandise and make improvements to his store

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Business Description

Mr. A. has had his business selling various meats and tropical fruit for one year and his wife helps him attend to his customers. Currently sales are growing because he supplies various stores and restaurants in the area.

Loan Use

He wants to use the loan to buy merchandise and improve his store, as it is very small and he would like to be able to better attend to his clients.

Personal Information

He is 46 years old and has no children. His house is made of cane and his goal is to grow his business in order to one day be able to be in a better financial situation.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva volunteer.

Descripción del Negocio

El Señor A. se dedica a la venta de carnes varias y frutas tropicales, este negocio lo inicio hace 1 año y en la atención a sus clientes le ayuda su esposa, actualmente sus ventas esta creciendo ya que el es el proveedor de las diferentes tiendas y comedores que existen en el sector.

Uso del Préstamo

Quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de mercadería y adecuar el local ya que en la actualidad el espacio es muy pequeño para poder atender de una mejor manera a sus clientes.

Información Personal

Tiene 46 años y no tiene hijos, su vivienda es de caña y su meta es crecer en su negocio para un día poder tener una mejor forma de vida en cuanto a su economía.

loans.use: Buy merchandise and improve his store

loans.name: Fili

texts.en: Fili is a young mother 18 years old.  She is married with one child. For many years her family lived on a taro plantation. When she got married she decided to move on her own. She heard of SPBD through some of the village women.  She joined so she would be able to get some financial assistant to start her business.  With her first loan she will buy the equipment she needs.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her chips business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase fabric and a machine to add buttons

loans.name: Faanimo

texts.en: Faanimo came from a family of seven. She is 20 years of age and single. Her two brothers overseas help to support the family, but her family also runs a plantation as their main source of income. Having a large family and relying on the plantation were the reasons why Faanimo decided to join SPBD. She heard of SPBD through the village women; She joined so she could have something of her own. She chose to make pancakes because she is close to the village school and because the village people could buy from her anytime. This is Faanimo's first loan and she is very happy for the opportunity so she could develop her family in the future.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her pancakes business

loans.name: Sina Tusa

texts.en: Sina is one of the oldest members for of the Samusu village borrowing centre. She is 67 years of age, a widow of 5 children and ten grandchildren. Sina's family used to live in the town but when her husband passed away eight months ago she decided to move to the village where they used to live before. Having a large family was hard especially raising the children and grandchildren. Her children now looking after the plantation, but she decided to do something to occupy her time. This is Sina's first loan and she very delighted with the opportunity given to earn more money to develop her family.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for her plantation and popcorn/ice-cake business

loans.name: Fusato

texts.en: Fusato is a single 19 year old woman who runs her own flea market stall. The key to her success is hard work. She joined SPBD in April this year to start a pancake business and within six months opened a flea market stall. With the help of her mother, she could have never made it this far. This will be Fusato's second loan and she plans to move onto bigger things in the future. She enjoys watching her business improve, and watching her family develop.

loans.use: To buy supplies and inventory for her flea market stall

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia worked as a nurse for 15 years, but she began to have arthritis in her hands and knees from the work and had to quit the job. As a single mother, she still had to take care of her three children and provide for their education, so she started selling used clothing and toys in January 1987. She had some sales experience because previously she had sold cosmetics in her free time. Back then, she needed to sell many items to able to cover her expenses, so she went to the outskirts of local markets (she couldn't afford to pay for a post inside). With a lot of hard work she was able to set up outposts in all the open markets in the region and a larger space to sell her goods.

With Christmas time fast approaching, Alicia wants to offer a wider variety of the toys children want. She is requesting a loan of $850, which she plans to repay within six months, to purchase more supplies for her customers. With your help Alicia can grow her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Alicia trabajó 15 años como enfermera pero comenzó a enfermarse de reumas en las manos y en las rodillas por el esfuerzo que hacía en el trabajo y tuvo que dejar de trabajar, pero como es madre soltera de tres hijos, y tenía que mantenerlos y darles estudio, comenzó a dedicarse a la venta de ropa usada y de juguetes. En Enero de1987, Alicia tenía cierta experiencia en ventas ya que antes se había dedicado a la venta de cosméticos en sus ratos libres, pero ese año por necesidad tuvo que vender más cosas para poder completar para sus gastos, y así que comenzó a vender en las orillas de los mercados ambulantes porque las personas que ya tenían tiempo la corrían ya que no pagaba las cuotas que ellos exigían, y así con mucho esfuerzo fue agarrando su lugar en todos los mercados ambulantes de la región y un espacio más grande donde poner su puesto.

Sin embargo la temporada navideña le exige tener más variedad para vender los juguetes que tantos niños quieren. Por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $850 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Alicia podrá comprar más mercancía para que sus clientes puedan tener de dónde escoger. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Alicia pueda crecer su pequeño negocio.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for Christmas season

loans.name: Solotua

texts.en: Solotua is a 28 year old mother who is married with 3 children. Her husband is unemployed. Fishing is their only source of income. Solotua decided to do something so she could earn money herself to assist her husband and her family. In her handcrafting business, she makes fans, baskets, kava bowls of different sizes, and many other intricate objects. She is very talented in designing handcrafted objects. Solotua's second loan will help her to buy more equipment and to build a proper place to store and sell her handcrafted objects.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her handicrafts business

loans.name: Alma Irene

texts.es:
Alma is a very enterprising and strong woman with dreams of moving ahead in life. Lacking a higher education, Alma and her husband thought about starting their own business to help solve their household expenses and provide for their two small children. Her husband is a fisherman, so they thought of having a seafood business at a local fish market called La Puntilla. They have since acquired a post in the market, and little by little they have established their business.

Winter is by far the most difficult season to sell seafood, with the supply dwindling and the prices rising. So Alma is requesting a loan of $575, which she will repay within six months, to purchase fish and seafood so they can have more merchandise. With your help, Alma, her husband and her children will be able to have Thanksgiving dinner and be happy they're together and no have to worry about money.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Alma es una persona muy fuerte, con deseos de salir adelante y muy emprendedora. La falta de estudios de su esposo y la de Alma los obligó a pensar en poner un negocio para tener un ingreso que les ayudara a solventar los gastos de su casa y sus dos pequeños hijos. El esposo de Alma era pescador, por eso pensaron en poner un negocio de mariscos en un mercado de pescados y mariscos (llamado La Puntilla),desde entonces han seguido con su local y poco a poco se van estabilizando.

Sin embargo el invierno para un vendedor de mariscos es la época más difícil, puesto que la pesca se va haciendo más pequeña y por lo tanto los precios de los productos se hacen más altos. Por lo tanto Alma está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlo en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero poder comprar los pescados y tener material para surtir en el mercado. Con tu ayuda Alma, su esposo y sus hijos, podrán tener una cena de acción de gracias en familia y felices por estar juntos y sin preocupaciones de dinero.

loans.use: Purchase fish and seafood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cylinders of gas

loans.name: Aitofi

texts.en: Aitofi is 76 years of age and a widow of 12 children. She has a big plantation in the village and with the children's support they have managed to get to where they are now. Aitofi is also a very hard working mother and that is the reason why she is always fit and very healthy. This is Aitofi's second loan with SPBD, she is thankful for the opportunity to be able to support her family and to upgrade her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy equipment and supplies for her plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the eating area

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es:
Angélica is a single mother. Her daughter, Martha Pamela, is 11 years old, and Angélica focuses all her efforts on giving her a better quality of life. Money from the job she has a local plant isn't enough to provide for her daughter's education and pay the bills, and Martha's father doesn't give them any support. To earn extra income, Angélica sells beauty products and cosmetic supplies in her free time. Thanks to the help of her daughter, who offers the products to her teachers and the parents of her classmates, Angélica has been able to acquire numerous customers.

Of course, many times Angélica's efforts aren't enough, and her business still doesn't provide enough for the family on its own. To restock her products, Angélica is requesting a loan of $1,125, which she will repay within six months. The money will help Angélica purchase more merchandise so customers will go to her during Christmas time. With your help Angélica and little Martha will be able to keep moving ahead together.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Angélica, es madre soltera de Martha Pamela de 11 años de edad, y por ella está haciendo todo su esfuerzo por brindarle una mejor calidad de vida, puesto que con el trabajo que tiene de planta no le alcanza el dinero para poder mantener los gastos de la escuela y del hogar. Y el papá de la pequeña Martha no las apoya con los gastos. Actualmente, se dedica en sus tiempos libres a vender artículos de belleza y cosméticos. Los cuales gracias a su empeño y el apoyo que le brinda su hija al ofrecer los productos a sus maestras y a las mamás de sus compañeritos ah podido adquirir varias clientas.

Sin embargo los esfuerzos en muchas ocasiones nos son suficientes en este momento, puesto que su negocio todavía no puede mantenerse por sí solo, para resurtir los productos por lo tanto Angélica está solicitando un crédito de US $ 1,125 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Angélica podrá comprar más mercancía que sus clientas compran en estas temporadas navideñas. Con tu ayuda Angélica y la pequeña Martha podrán salir adelante juntas.

loans.use: Purchase beauty supplies and cosmetics

loans.name: Lucila Oralia

texts.es:
Lucila is an active, hard-working, responsible, enterprising, and strong person. After working several years as a teacher, she decided to take advantage of her love for sales and try her luck selling beauty products, because the money she was making was not enough to cover her expenses.

In 1997, thanks to an invitation from a friend, Lucila thought she could obtain better income and establish her own work schedule. Since then, she has been getting ahead in her business so she does not regret having taken that opportunity.

However, during Christmas season, her clients start buying products as gifts and for personal use, and that is why Lucila is requesting a loan for US$1,125, to be paid within 6 months. With this money Lucila will be able to buy merchandise to offer a great variety of products to her clients. With your help, Lucila will be able to make her dream of growing in the world of sales come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Lucila es una persona activa, trabajadora, responsable, emprendedora y fuerte. Que después de trabajar varios años como maestra, decide aprovechar su gran gusto por las ventas y para probar su suerte en la venta de productos de belleza, puesto que el dinero que ganaba no le rendía para sus gastos. En 1997, gracias a la invitación de una amiga Lucila pensó que podría obtener mejores ingresos y establecer su propio horario de trabajo. Desde entonces ha ido ascendiendo dentro de su actividad por lo tanto hoy no se arrepiente de haber intentado esta oportunidad.

Sin embargo en la época navideña, sus clientas comienzan a comprar productos para regalos y/o de uso personal, es por eso que Lucila está solicitando un crédito de US $ 1,125 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero Lucila podrá comprar mercancía para ofrecerles una gran variedad de productos a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Lucila podrá cumplir su sueño de crecer en el mundo de las ventas.

loans.use: Buying seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Maima

texts.en: Maima is 28 years old, married, and has three children. She currently lives with her parents. Her husband works for one of the local companies within the town, but her weekly salary is not sufficient enough to support the whole family. Maima decided to do something so she could earn money for herself. This will be Maima’s second loan with SPBD, and she is selling pork buns and donuts to her village school. Maima is planning to run in addition a canteen vending business in school to enable her to sell more products.

loans.use: To buy supplies and materials for her food stall

loans.name: Rocío

texts.es:
The money Rocio's husband made was not enough to cover all the expenses and their 5 daughters. Their daughters were growing, and their need for food, clothes, and schooling were growing too and it was hard for them to cover those needs. Aware of this need, Rocio decided it was time for her to look for extra money for the household expenses. That is why in August 1999 she started helping a friend with collecting payments for the ceramic products her friend sold, and Rocio received 20%. Later, Rocio realized she could have her own business, and starting in 2004 she began to invest in small quantities of ceramics, and later, with the help of her daughters, she has been increasing her business.

Rocio's intent is to keep growing and to be able to consolidate her business. This is why she is requesting a loan for US $ 575 to be paid in a period of 6 months. With this money, Rocio will be able to buy more merchandise to offer to her clients, especially during the nearing Christmas season, during which people buy lots of decorations for their house. With your help, you'll help Rocio make her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

El dinero que ganaba el esposo de Rocío no era suficiente para cubrir todos los gastos y sus 5 hijas, puesto que estaban creciendo, y por lo mismo, las necesidades de sustento, ropa y estudio eran cada vez más grandes y se les dificultaba cubrir dichas necesidades. Viendo esta necesidad Rocío decidió que era momento de buscar dinero extra para los gastos del hogar. Y fue así que en Agosto de 1999 comenzó a ayudarle a una amiga a cobrar la cerámica que ella vendía y le pagaba el 20%. Después se dio cuenta que ella podía tener su propio negocio y a partir del 2004 empezó a invertir en poquita cerámica y desde entonces con la ayuda de sus hijas ha ido creciendo el negocio.

Pero la intensión de Rocío es seguir creciendo y poder consolidar su negocio y es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con ese dinero Rocío podrá comprar más mercancía para poder ofrecer a sus clientes, sobre todo para esta época navideña que ya se acerca y la gente compra muchos adornos para su casa. Con tu ayuda lograrás que Rocío pueda hacer su sueño realidad.

loans.use: Buying ceramic figurines as merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more merchandise

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
Some time ago, Eleuterio worked as a truck driver, but downsizing in his company resulted in him being fired. This left him and his family without money to survive. With a lot of effort and with help from relatives, in 1991 Eleuterio and his family opened a general store, and little by little they began to increase their inventory and clientele. Thanks to the attitude of all his family, the business has become well known among the people who live in Sabinas.

However, like all businesses, this one has good times and bad times. Recently, they had many expenses, and so the store was left with a very low inventory. This is why they are requesting a loan of US $475, to be paid in 6 months, to be able to buy merchandise to have a better variety of products. With your help, Eleuterio and his family will be able to succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Hace tiempo, Eleuterio trabajó como chofer de camiones de carga, pero un reajuste en su empresa, hizo que lo despidieran, dejándolo a él y su familia sin dinero para sobrevivir, y con mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de sus familiares en 1991 Eleuterio y su familia comenzaron a vender productos de abarrotes, y así poco a poco comenzaron a crecer el repertorio de sus productos, y haciéndose de clientela. Gracias a la disposición que tiene toda su familia, el negocio está haciéndose más conocido entre la gente que vive en Sabinas.

Sin embargo, como todos los negocios tiene temporadas buenas y malas, y actualmente tuvieron muchos gastos, por lo tanto la tienda de abarrotes quedó con muy poca mercancía, por lo tanto están solicitando un crédito de US $475 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con esto poder comprar mercancía para tener mayor surtido en sus productos. Con tu ayuda la familia de Eleuterio podrá salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise to replenish his business' inventory.

loans.name: Matauaina

texts.en: Matauaina is a married mother of 45 years of age who has 6 children. Her family has been in a fishing business for a very long time and this was their only source of income. Her husband is a carpenter and his salary every week is not sufficient to support the family. Matauaina believes that fishing can earn more money than any other business. This is the reason why she spends all her time to make sure her fishing business can be very successful in the future. Matauaina is very thankful that one day, she will have a bigger boat and own much more fishing gear than she has now.

loans.use: To repair her canoe and buy new fishing gear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more office supplies and improve the appearance of his business

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
Ana Maria's husband works selling wood. With this job, they do not make enough to cover their children's expenses. This is why Ana Maria decided to start a business to have extra income for the household, because Ana Maria hopes her 5 children will have a successful future based on schooling. After thinking for a while about which business would work out better for her, she decided to start selling natural products door to door, because she knows there are many people who like these products.

Nowadays she has many clients who ask her for salves and herbs and other products. However, there are some herbs that can only be found in the winter season, and this is why Ana Maria is requesting a loan for US $ 925, which she is sure she can pay in 6 months. She will use this money to buy merchandise that is on sale for a very good price in this season, so she can have it for the whole year.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

El esposo de Ana María se dedica a la venta de madera, y con este trabajo, no le alcanza para pagar los gastos de sus hijos, es por eso que Ana María decidió poner un negocio para poder tener ingresos extras para el hogar. Puesto que Ana María desea que sus 5 hijos puedan tener un futuro próspero a base de estudios. Después de pensar un tiempo en qué negocio sería el que le funcionaría mejor, decidió comenzar a vender casa por casa productos naturistas, puesto que sabe que hay muchos seguidores de estos productos.

Actualmente tiene muchos clientes que le piden ungüentos, hierbas y otros productos, sin embargo hay hierbas que sólo se consiguen en la temporada de invierno y es por eso que Ana María está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está segura va a poder pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y este dinero lo utilizará para poder comprar la mercancía, que en esta temporada está en un muy buen precio, para tener en todo el año.

loans.use: Buying herbs that are available in the winter.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
The most important thing for Lorena's husband is to work hard so their family can make it. This is why he left to work as a migrant worker and make money to have something better to offer his wife and three children. However, the stress of having a family member gone is very high, because the time the jobs last and/or the time it takes for him to get paid is long. His family is left waiting, and they suffer from the separation and the lack of money. Lorena has not let this problem defeat her, and so she started selling clothing which she bought close to her town. After a while her husband started sending her clothes too. Little by little she has formed a clientele who looks forward to seeing the new merchandise she gets.

Lorena would like to buy merchandise in Chihuahua, because she is sure this merchandise is of good quality and could be sold very quickly. Because of this, she is requesting a loan of US $ 925, which she is sure to be able to pay in 6 months. This money will help her buy more merchandise and have more variety so her clients have a lot to choose from in this season. With your help, Lorena will be able to celebrate the Christmas season in the company of her children, always having in her heart the presence of her husband who left them to be able to offer them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Lo más importante para el esposo de Lorena es luchar por que salga adelante su familia, y por esto que se fue de inmigrante a trabajar y sacar dinero para poder tener algo mejor qué ofrecerle a su esposa y sus tres hijos. Sin embargo el esfuerzo de que un integrante de familia se vaya es mucho, puesto que el tiempo que durasen trabajo, y/o el que tarda para que le paguen es mucho. Y la familia que se queda esperándolo, es la que sufre por la separación, y por la falta de dinero. Lorena no se dejó vencer por este problema y comenzó a vender ropa que compraba, cerca de su pueblo, y después de un tiempo su esposo le empezó a mandar ropa. Y poco a poco ha ido haciéndose de clientes que esperan a ver qué es lo que tiene de nuevo.

Sin embargo Lorena, desea comprar mercancía en Chihuahua, que está segura es de muy buena calidad y se podrá vender muy rápido, por lo tanto está solicitando un crédito de US $925 que está segura podrá pagar en un plazo de 6 meses. Este dinero le servirá para ir a surtirse de mercancía y tener más variedad para que sus clientas, tengan de dónde escoger en esta temporada. Con tu ayuda Lorena podrá celebrar las fiestas navideñas en compañía de sus hijos, teniendo siempre en el corazón a su esposo que se alejó de ellos para ofrecerles un mejor futuro.

loans.use: buying merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more dishes, ingredients and beverages

loans.name: Francisco Guadalupe

texts.es:
Sadly, Francisco's wife suffers from uterine cancer, which makes her unable to work and help with the household expenses. It is because of this, and because of all the expenses from this illness and their young daughter, that he started working in construction. Five years ago he worked as a bricklayer's helper. Thanks to Francisco’s dedication and his ability to learn quickly, he raised to the rank of bricklayer. As a bricklayer he was able to learn more things about construction, and so he can now work on construction.

Currently, he as many jobs to do, but the tools he has are very old and often make his job harder, rather than easier. This is why he is requesting a loan for US $925 to be paid in 6 months. With this money he will be able to buy a mixer, which will allow him to do his job better. With your help, Francisco will be able to cope with this terrible illness and do what is necessary for his wife and daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Desgraciadamente la esposa de Francisco se encuentra enferma de cáncer en la Matriz, lo que hace que ella no pueda trabajar y ayudar en los gastos del hogar, y por eso y por todos los gastos que requiere esta enfermedad y su pequeña hija comenzó a dar servicio para la construcción. Hace 5 años trabajó como ayudante de albañil, gracias a su dedicación y a la facilidad de aprender subió al rango de albañil, y ya como albañil, le permitió aprender más cosas sobre la construcción. Y poderse dedicar a la construcción.

Actualmente tiene varios trabajos por hacer, pero las herramientas que tiene son muy viejas y en muchas ocasiones en lugar de ayudarle hacen más difícil su trabajo, es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar una revolvedora para poder hacer mejor su trabajo. Con tu ayuda Francisco podrá sobrellevar esta terrible enfermedad y pagar lo que le sea necesario para su esposa e hija.

loans.use: buying a cement mixer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete the construction of her home

loans.name: José Andrés

texts.es:
Andre always dreamt about marrying the woman with whom he fell deeply in love, but he needed to be able to offer her a future. He began to think about the possibilities available to him and he decided to take advantage and use his knowledge and experience with computers to open up an internet service business. Another benefit was that he was located across the street from a school. His business provides computer rental, battery charging and computer sales. Andre is grateful that this business provided him the means to overcome his expenses and he was able to get married.

Now, Andre believes that he should offer more computer related services to his clients, and so he's requesting a loan of $575 USD (to be paid in 6 months). With this loan Andre will be able to purchase new technical/computer accessories like: a scanner, a web camera, and other items which will make his services more attractive to his clients. With your help Andre's business will continue to grow and one day he will be able to start a family.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Gould, Kiva volunteer.

Andrés siempre soñó con casarse con la mujer de quien se enamoró profundamente, pero necesitaba poder ofrecerle un futuro. Y comenzó a pensar de qué manera él podría sacar dinero para mantener a su esposa. Aprovechando los conocimientos en mantenimiento de computación y al ver que frente a su casa había una escuela, decidió abrir un cyber, y dar servicio de renta de computadoras, recarga de cartuchos, venta de equipo de computo. Gracias a este negocio Andrés a podido sobrellevar los gastos desde que se casó.

Sin embargo, Andrés cree necesario que su negocio se consolide y abarque más opciones dentro del mundo de la computación. Es por eso que está solicitando un crédito de US $575 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses, y con este dinero Andrés podrá comprar accesorios nuevos, como scanner, cámaras web, entre otras cosas que harán que el negocio sea más atractivo para los clientes. Con tu ayuda lograrás que el negocio de Andrés crezca cada vez más y en un futuro logre tener hijos.

loans.use: To purchase computer related products in order to offer better services in his internet business. (Comprar artúculos para ofrecer un mejor servicio a los clientes)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more cylinders of gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy tools and hardware to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest in more inventory for the holiday season

loans.name: Shukufe

texts.en:
D. Shukufa is a 42-year-old. She is from Corat settlement of Sumgayit City. She is the mother of three children. She is a farmer. She started his business in 2006 when she purchased five sheep with money she had saved up. She is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy.  She buys sheep and lambs and raises them in a half-year. The work is interesting, but it is time consuming and takes a lot of effort. At the same time, the salary is not enough to cover all of the family expenses. 

She would like to receive a $400 loan in order to acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes eventually to expand this business, which will further improve the living condition of her family.

loans.use: To acquire 2 small bulls and feed for them.

loans.name: Rafail

texts.en:
E. Rafail has been engaged in this business for 3 years. He is from Corat settlement of Sumgayit City, situated in the eastern part of the Azerbaijan Republic. He is married and the father of three children.  He has his own small shop. This 27-year-old man is the only breadwinner in family. With this business he earns little money. This money is currently enough for only some of his family's basic needs. He has difficulty in covering all family needs. 
He needs $500. With this loan he will expand his business by  buying other types of food. He'll be improving his family living condition. He wants increase number of his clients. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: With this loan he will expand his business by buying other sorts of food.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
GLORIA, age 49, supports a house of 7 with her bar and liquor store, “T. Square Take Away Drinks.” Although she has no children of her own, she and her husband take care of 5 relatives’ children, three of which have been orphaned. Gloria’s husband, who used to work for the local phone company, is now without a job because of a stroke that affected his memory.

Gloria’s bar and shop opened around 2½ years ago and now employs 5 workers. This business brings Gloria an average profit of around $20 a day, from its 10-20 customers on the weekdays and 50 on the weekends.

Gloria has taken out two previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to buy a deep freezer and initial stock for her liquor store. Having paid these back successfully, she now hopes for a third loan to increase her inventory and buy chairs for her bar.

Gloria belongs to the group Makete (named after their district in Dar es Salaam), which consists of 15 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase inventory and buy chairs

payments.comment: Gloria was able to pay the remaining of her loan before the end of her loan term!

loans.name: Ruzigar

texts.en:
D. Ruzigar has been engaged in this business for 2 years. She is from the Corat settlement of Sumgayit City. She is the mother of three children. She began her business with $300 in 2005. At first, she was selling children's clothing and earning little money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. 
Now she is busy with mobile industry goods, retail trade. She wants improve her business and increase the number of her clients. Ruzigar needs $400 to expand her business, to open her own shop for selling industry goods in the central market. She hopes eventually to expand her business.
She thinks that this expansion will improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To open area of private trade for selling of the industry goods in the central market

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma J. is 42-years-old and is raising 3 sons and 1 orphaned nephew with her husband. While her husband works as a driver for schools, transporting books and chemical equipment between Kenya and Tanzania, Salma decided to start 2 small businesses of her own.

Three years ago, Salma began working to supply eggs to various hotels and cafes around Dar es Salaam. At 6am on Mondays, Thursdays, and Sundays, she collects the eggs from the wholesalers and distributes them during the rest of the day. Buying a tray of 30 eggs for around $2.70, she can sell them for about $3.50. During certain festive seasons of the year, she travels to Zanzibar, an island 4 hours by ferry from Dar es Salaam, to sell trays there for about $6.40 each.

Salma’s second business is a fruit stand in front of their home, which she just opened 3 months ago. There, she sells mangos, papaya, watermelon, and bananas. In two weeks, she can make a profit of around $30 from her fruit sales.

Salma hopes to take out a loan to buy more eggs in order to increase her business as an egg-supplier. She belongs to the group Airport (due to their location near the national airport), which consists of 17 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs to supply to hotels and cafes

payments.comment: Salma has successfully paid the remaining of her loan before the end of her loan term!

loans.name: Wiliemina

texts.en:
WILIEMINA, age 36, lives with her husband and 2 girls (ages 13 and 15). While her husband works as a traffic controller at the airport, Wiliemina decided to start her own business. Three years ago, she began selling fabrics on the street and from door-to-door. She feels very happy to be working.

Twice a month, Wiliemina travels to purchase the fabrics in Kigoma, a town that is a two-day train ride away, costing almost $60. In Kigoma, Wiliemina buys 50-60 pieces of fabric for around $18 per piece, which she will sell in Dar es Salaam for $22-27 each.

Wiliemina hopes to take out a loan to increase her stock. She belongs to the group Airport (due to their location near the national airport), which consists of 17 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase stock

payments.comment: Wiliemina has successfully paid the remaining of her loan before the end of her loan term!

loans.name: Khalima

texts.en:
KHALIMA, age 48, has sold fabrics from door-to-door for over 8 years. Having been left by her husband only 5 years after marriage, she raised her two children as a single mother. Now that her children have grown, she lives with her older sister and nephew, age 30.

Khalima spends her week buying the fabrics from downtown Dar es Salaam and then selling them on the street and to various homes from 8am to 2pm. In a week, she sells an average of 35 dresses or pieces of fabric to around 20 customers. Each month, she earns around $180. With a loan, Khalima hopes to increase her stock.

Khalima belongs to the group Airport (due to their location near the national airport), which consists of 17 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To increase her stock

payments.comment: Khalima successfully paid the remaining of her loan before the end of the loan term!

loans.name: Iyabode

texts.en:
I sell drinks and wine, I need a loan of $400 to enable me buy more crates of drinks and all kinds of wine for sale, says Iyabode A., who lives in Ijanikin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 49 years old, married with 3 children
 nd  has been with LAPO for 3 years. She has 5 years' experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and wine for sale

loans.name: Bolale

texts.en: Bolale J. is happily married with 3 children, 35 years of age and comes from Iyenkin town in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells frozen chicken, tomatoes and pepper. She has been in business since 1980. She needs the loan of $800 to buy more frozen chicken, tomatoes and pepper for sale.

loans.use: To buy more frozen chicken & tomatoes and pepper for sale

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo T. is 38 years of age, married with 2 children, and has been an LAPO client for the past 3 years. She is from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells bag of rice. She has been in business since 2004 and needs the loan of $625 to buy more bags rice for sale.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty U. is 25 years of age, married with 2 children, and hails from Mebamu in Lagos State, Nigeria. She makes calls, sells recharge cards, honey, and chin chin. She has been in business since 2006 and needs the loan of $250 to buy more goods for sales.

loans.use: Making of calls, sells of recharge card, and chin chin bottle of honey

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther N. is 39 years old, married with a child, and hails from Mabamu in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been a leader of a union under LAPO for the past 3 years. She sells drugs and drinks. She has been in business for the past 6 years and needs the loan of $800 to buy more drugs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy O. is 31 years old and happily married with 3 children. She is from Mebamu, a town in Lagos state, and she sells electronics and electrical materials. She has been in business since 2003 and needs the loan of $250 to buy more electrical materials for sale.

loans.use: To buy more electronics for sale

loans.name: Ujunwa

texts.en: C. Ujunwa is 46 years old; she is a widow and a mother of 4 who comes from Mebamu, a semi rural area in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been with LAPO as a client for the past 5 years. She sells drinks and pure water. She needs the loan of $625 to buy more drinks, recharge cards, and pure water for sale.

loans.use: To buy drinks, cards, and bags of pure water

loans.name: Komugisha

texts.en:
Komugisha is 38-years-old and has raised her children (ages 11 and 16) as a single parent after her husband left her in 1997. She also takes care of the children (ages 14 and 15) of her physically handicapped sister who lives in the village.

Five years ago, Komugisha opened a café, which she named “Mama Lishe Otagaya” (meaning “don’t judge me” cafe). She explained that she chose this name because this business is how she makes a living despite stereotypes associated with such street cafes.

Around 50 customers come to Komugisha’s café daily, which is open for breakfast, lunch, and dinner from 5am to 8pm, 6 days a week. Komugisha hires 2 assistants to help her with the cooking, paying them each a salary of around $70 per month. After paying her café’s rent of about $18, Komugisha brings in a profit of around $135 each month.

With a loan, Komugisha hopes to buy food items to increase her business. She belongs to the group Airport (named after their location near the national airport), which consists of 17 other members who keep each other accountable and insure one another in paying back their loans.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes P. is a widow and a mother of 2 children. She is 52 years old and hails from semi rural area in Lagos State. She is a farmer and she is into vegetable farming (pankin). She has been in her business since 1992 and needs the loan of $175 to buy more pankin seedily for planting and farm maintenance. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more pankin seedily for planting

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria I. is married, 44 years of age, and hails from Ijainki in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a stylist who also sells weavons and relaxers. She has been into this business since 1988. She needs the loan of $800 to buy more weavons, attachments and hair cream for sale. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, relaxer and dryer

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: "I will invest the fund into foodstuffs and honey business," says Joy O., who lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 40 years old, married with 3 children. She has been in this business since 2007 and needs the loan of $400 to buy more foodstuff and honey for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and honey

loans.name: Idiatu

texts.en: "I hope to buy more drinks and provisions to enable me to increase my worth of goods," says Idiatu G., who lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 49 years, married with 5 children, and has been in this business since the year 1984. She hopes to get the loan of $400 to buy more drinks and provisions.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and provisions

loans.name: Kekelomo

texts.en: Kekelomo A. is a mother of 4 children and she is 55 years old. She hails from Ajagbadin in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a group leader at LAPO. She sells clothes and has been in this business since 1987. She needs the loan of $1175 to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Osolo

texts.en: Osolo T. is a mother of 4 children and she is 52 years of age. She hails from Ajangbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells eggs. She has been in her business since the year 1986 and needs the loan of $1175 to buy more eggs for sale. This, she said, will make her serve her customers better. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs for sale

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua owns a cloth stall in the central Kumasi market. She inherited the shop after working there for 10 years. Her first year of ownership was difficult as she had no capital to expand the shop. So Akua decided to use her extra time selling food on the streets. With the extra money she earned, the shop slowly expanded. Now, 5 years later, she carries not only cotton cloth, but also blankets, towels, and polyester cloth.

Akua needs a loan to expand her shop even more by selling “lace cloth”. Lace cloth is very popular for making the elegant Ghanaian dresses (called “kaba and sliht” in Twi) that women wear for formal occasions. Akua believes a wider variety of cloth will attract more customers. This will also increase business for the seamstresses in the market.

Back at home, she hopes her son will graduate from high school this year. If he does, she will use the extra income to help send him to university

(*Photo Note: Ekua is on the left wearing "kaba and sliht.")

loans.use: To expand her shop by purchasing 30 pieces of lace cloth and polyester cloth

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia D. C. is happily married with 4 children. She is 36 years of age and hails from Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and bags. She has been in business for the past 6 years and seeks an amount of $1175 to buy more shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and bags for sale. This, she said, will help her business to grow. She thanks you.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, cosmetics, clothes, and bags for sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary I. is a widow and she is 40 years old. She has a big family; she has 3 children. Mary sells gift items, baking materials and flours in her shop. She has 10 years experience. She needs a loan of $1175 to enable her buy more gift items, baking materials and flours for sale.

loans.use: To buy more gift items, baking materials and flours for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria A. is 37 and has been working in Kumasi’s central market since she was 15. Her experience in the market has made her one of the more successful traders. Victoria buys jewelry and cloth at wholesale prices and distributes it personally to various stalls inside the market.

Victoria would like to distribute higher quality products, but will need a loan to do so. With the loan, she wishes to purchase 20 yards of lace cloth and 4 gold necklaces. In the future, she hopes to save enough money to own her own stall in the market.

(*Photo Note: Victoria, right, is with one of her customers the market)

loans.use: To purchase 20 yards of lace cloth and 4 necklaces.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sra. Sofia has belonged to the "Vecinas Unidas" (Neighbors United) community bank for 5 years. She lives in the Peruvian region or "departamento" of Ucayali. She is 48 years old and the mother of 1 son. Her husband works on the service staff at a local school. Sofia earns a living running a small food and drinks business at the entrance to another school.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$333), to be repaid in 4 months, Sofia will be able to add new items for sale, like cookies and candy, as well as a display case to better show off her products.

Sofia is pleased that she can provide for her family's basic needs and that her household can continue to do better and better.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Sofía pertenece al Banco Comunal “Vecinas Unidas” desde hace 5 años, su vivienda esta ubicada en el Jr. Morona 144 del Distrito de Callería del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 48 años y es madre de 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja en un colegio como personal de servicio. En la actualidad cuenta con un pequeño negocio de venta de frutas, comida y bebidas, en la puerta de un colegio.

Con el reciente préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/.1,000 (US$ 333.00 aprox.), que lo pagará en 4 meses, podrá implementar su negocio con dulces, golosinas y una vitrina para una mejor presentación de sus productos.

Sofia se siente contenta de poder satisfacer sus necesidades primordiales y asi poder sentirse realizada al poder aportar para el desarrollo de su hogar.

loans.use: Buy a display case and new products for food business.

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina, pictured here with her loan officer, is a hard working widow who has recently experienced some very difficult life circumstances. Galina’s husband passed away not long ago so the responsibilities of supporting herself and her eleven year old daughter have fallen to her. Galina works at a job where she receives a salary and also runs her own business selling women’s clothing. Though well established, the business has gone through a rough time as well and she basically had to start over. In addition to these difficulties, Galina’s six month old granddaughter is unable to move her feet and requires a lengthy course of treatment. Galina hopes to use income from her business to assist in getting the medical care her granddaughter needs. 

Galina has requested a loan of $1200 to help purchase new inventory to sell in her clothing business. Despite her difficult circumstances, Galina is optimistic about the future and is looking forward to continue developing her business and earning the income she needs for herself and her family.

loans.use: purchase inventory

loans.name: Gladis Bertha

texts.es:
With a lot of effort and the help of her husband and sons, Gladys has been able to open a small shop in the city of Lima to which she dedicates a great deal of her time. With everybody helping, there is also time to harvest the crops on their small parcels of land which brings in extra income. Even with a few steady income streams, the money is not enough to cover the costs for medical treatment as she and her husband get older. Because of this, Gladys is requesting a loan to expand the products she offers and grow her business, helping them reach their goals and improve their quality of life.

Gladis ha podido abrir con mucho esfuerzo y ayuda de su querido esposo una pequeña bodega en la ciudad de Lima, a que le dedican gran parte de su tiempo. Para llevar las riendas de su negocio cuentan con el importante apoyo de sus queridos hijos y esto les da tiempo para continuar con la siembra de productos en sus parcelas de tierras a fin de obtener un ingreso adicional.A pesar de tener algunos ingresos muy sólidos, este dinero es insuficiente para solventar los gastos que genera su tratamiento médico, por el sinnúmero de dolencias que los aquejan por la avanzada edad que poseen.Ha consecuencia de este hecho, Gladys, tiene pensado mejorar sus productos y su negocio. Solicita un préstamo y apela a tu bondadoso corazón para acumular la suma que requiere con el objetivo de poner en marcha sus anhelos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: THE LOAN WILL BE USE TO HELP GROW THEIR BUSINESS, AND GENERATE MORE INCOME TO COVER MEDICAL EXPENSES.

loans.name: Larysa

texts.en:
Larysa is from Kharkov, Ukraine where she has a business selling bed coverings and towels. She loves these types of “homey” things and has developed what she enjoys into a good business. She currently has two sales locations with plans for a third and would eventually like to purchase a store facility. Larysa supports herself and two children with income from her business.

Larysa has requested a loan to help further her business expansion by purchasing new inventory and renting a third sales location. Larysa has benefited from several loans through Nadiya Ukraine and has built a good reputation. We are excited to see how her business will continue to grow and develop in the future.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.en:
Lidiya owns a little shoe stand at the busy Barabashovo Market in Kharkov, Ukraine. She has worked hard over the past eight years to develop a successful, profitable business. Lidiya loves what she does and it shows in how she conducts her business. Lidiya is married and has one daughter. 

Lidiya has requested a loan to increase her working capital and help purchase a new selection of shoes and boots for the colder season. She is hoping for high sales during this busy time of year and would like to be prepared with adequate inventory. Lidiya has proven to be a reliable and stable client with Nadiya Ukraine. We are happy for this new opportunity to help her with her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en: Ludmila has a small clothing sales business located at the Barabushovo Market in Kharkov, the second largest city in Ukraine. She is married and has a son and daughter. In business for eleven years, she has worked hard over the years to develop a successful business and help meet the needs of her family. Ludmila currently sells a selection of women’s clothing. She has requested a loan of $1200 to help open a new sales kiosk and purchase inventory to sell. Ludmila enjoys being self-employed and would like to continue growing and developing her business.

loans.use: Open a new kiosk

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya has been able to combine her love of children with a successful business selling children’s clothing at a busy market in Kharkov, Ukraine. Her business is one of the best in town with good quality products and several locations. Natalya currently has two sales kiosks at the market as well as a large shipping container that she sells from. Eventually, Natalya would like to open a store in a permanent facility. Natalya and her husband, Stanislav have one child, a daughter. Stanislav is also a business owner.

Natalya has requested a loan to help purchase new inventory of hats and gloves. She will be able to help many children keep warm through the cold winter months and hopes to make a good profit by having the right inventory in stock to meet demand as the season changes.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei has a successful small business selling personal care products at the Sigma-sport merchant complex in Nikolaev, Ukraine. From his little kiosk, Sergei sells an assortment of good quality, hard-to-find hair and nail care products. His business, which he has operated for about eight, years provides the main source of income for him and his wife, Oksana, and their fifteen year old daughter. In the future, Sergei hopes to expand by opening a second sales location.

Sergei has requested a loan of $600 to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. We are happy for this opportunity to provide the means for Sergei to continue developing his business.

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Gladys Clara

texts.es:
Gladys is much admired as a good mother, an example of a hardworker with a lot of courage. She suffered a great deal when her husband left her, though he did come back to her and she decided to give him another chance. They grow bananas, coffee and pineapple, which they sell in the city of Huancayo after they harvest. THey are now looking to expand their sales in the capital as well. This expansion of their business motivates them, and they are dedicating more time to the cultivation and care of their products, while stil taking care of their home and their two sons. One of their sons has decided to attend the university of Huancayo, which makes his parents very proud.

Gladys wants to grow and improve the production of their crops, but they need fertilizers which cost a lot of money during the planting season. For this reason she is requesting a loan of $300 to be able to buy the necessary materials to make her harvest abundant and of the highest quality, better positioning them to sell in the capital. They count on your kind support so they may realize their goals and grow the business.

Doña Gladys es una admirable madre de familia que siempre dio ejemplo de trabajo y coraje a pesar de las adversidades y desengaños que sufrió a consecuencia del abandono de su esposo, quién regreso muy arrepentido y ella ha decidió darle una oportunidad más.Se dedican al cultivo de plátanos, café y piña en su gran extensión de terrenos que después de cosecharlos los llevan a comercializar a la ciudad de Huancayo y ahora con miras de repartirlos también en la ciudad capital.Este nuevo proyecto la anima a seguir esforzándose y ha dedicarle más tiempo a la siembra y al cuidado de sus productos, sin descuidar el cuidado de su casa y de sus pequeños dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos la llena de mucho orgullo porque a pesar de las carencias decidió forjarse un mejor futuro en la universidad de Huancayo.De manera que, doña Gladys, desea incrementar y mejorar la producción de sus frutas pero requiere de abonos y fertilizantes los cuales en esta época de masiva siembra son muy costosos y es por ello su solicitud de 300 dólares, para la compra abonos con el fin de que su cosecha sea abundante y de calidad y que puedan ser apetecibles y agradables para su comercialización y pueda ser un buen comienzo para la transportación de sus productos para la capital. Contamos con su tal gentil contribución para hacer realidad los anhelos de comercialización de doña Gladys.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS SUCH AS FERTILIZER TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY AND QUANTITY OF THEIR CROPS, HELPING THEM GROW THEIR BUSINESS AND EXPAND THEIR SALES.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es:
We find Abraham working energetically to cultivate bananas and pineapples. He dedicates a great amount of time to this every day, trying to build a better future for himself and his 5 year old son. Abraham became a single father after his wife left him and their young son in his care. He would like to make a bigger investment in his business and begin to sell his produce in the city of Santa Ana. This would enable him to save enough money to cover the needs of his son, create a safe and secure home and enjoy happy moments together. He is counting on your kind support.

Encontramos a Abraham, maestro de obras, trabajando animosamente en sus tierras cubiertas de platanales e inmensas y deliciosas piñas, a las que les dedica mucho tiempo con el propósito de forjarse día a día un futuro mejor para él y para su hijo de 5 años a quien su madre abandonó y lo dejo bajo el cariño y cuidados de su noble padre.Aprendió las labores del hogar desde que empezó a dedicarse a cuidar a su pequeño niño, mostrando gran habilidad y destreza. Abraham desea tener una mayor inversión de dinero en la producción de plátanos y así empezar su negocio de comercialización en la ciudad de Santa Ana, con el cual podrá empezar a ahorrar dinero para cubrir las necesidades de su pequeño, de manera que junto a su hijo puedan compartir momentos de alegría y el anhelo de establecerse en un hogar muy seguro. Contamos con su gentil y noble corazón.

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS BUSINESS CULTIVATING AND SELLING BANANAS AND PINEAPPLES, ENABLING HIM TO SAVE MONEY AND BETTER CARE FOR HIS YOUNG SON.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga makes paper bags used to hold food like hamburgers and salchipapas (a dish made of fries adorned with sausages) and sells the bags in measured quantities in La Paz and other parts of the country. The basic material she uses is recycled paper from the press. She has two sons that depend on her. Olga lives in the region of Alto Tacagua in the city of La Paz.

The requested loan will be used to increase paper production so she can meet the market's demands. This is the fourth loan with IMPRO. Her good payment history qualifies her for this loan. The three previous loans have all been paid.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Volunteer.

Olga hace sobres (paper bags) para hamburguesa y salchipapas y los comercializa por arrobas en La Paz y el interior del país; la materia prima que utiliza es papel reciclado de las imprentas. Tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella. Olga vive en la zona de Alto Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito requerido será utilizado para incrementar su materia prima (papel) y así satisfacer la demanda que tiene en su mercado. Es el cuarto crédito con IMPRO; el buen comportamiento de pago le permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado. Los tres créditos anteriores han sido cancelados en su totalidad.

loans.use: To buy paper for her products

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys and her husband are tailors and make school backpacks and sweatshirts. They sell both in popular markets around the city of El Alto. They have one baby son who is 3 years old. They live in the area of San Roque in the city of El Alto.

The requested loan will be used to purchase raw materials like cloth. This is her first loan with IMPRO. She has been evaluated and her social and economic standing qualifies her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Gladys y sus esposo son costureros y confeccionan mochilas para el colegio y buzos deportivos, los mismos que comercializa en las ferias populares de la Ciudad de El Alto. Tienen un pequeño hijo de 3 años. Viven en la zona San Roque de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito requerido será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela). Es el primer crédito con IMPRO y la evaluación socio-económica realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.

loans.use: to buy raw materials

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix owns a car that he uses as a radio taxi. The car is used as a inter-city public transport between La Paz and El Alto. His wife has a snack bar (tea, coffee, sandwich) which generates income that's used to cover costs like providing for his son. They live in the area of Los Andes in the city of El Alto.

The requested loan will be used to increase the amount of merchandise in his wife's snack bar, which will ultimately bring in greater income for the family. This is his fifth loan with IMPRO. A completed credit evaluation qualifies Félix for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Félix tiene su movilidad propia que trabaja de radio taxi - transporte publico inter ciudad La Paz - El Alto. Su esposa tiene una snack de refrigerios (té, café, sándwich) con cuyos ingresos alcanzan a cubrir los gastos de mantenimiento propios como los de su hijo; vive en la Zona Los Andes de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito solicitado será utilizado para incrementar la mercadería en su snack e incrementar sus ingresos familiares. Es el quinto crédito con IMPRO y la evaluación realizada permite aprobar el préstamo solicitada por Felix.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for his wife's snack bar

loans.name: Doryz

texts.es:
Doryz recycles plastics, nylon, paper and cartons. She works as a micro-entrepreneur with her two small daughters' support, who help her in this challenging job. This is her source of income that supports her 4 children. She lives in her parents' home that is located in the Villa Ingenio in th city of El Alto.

The loan will be used to realize her long yearned dream: to buy a piece of land to build her own home. This is her fourth loan with IMPRO. Her credit history approves her for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Geraldine Kim, Kiva Translator.

Doryz trabaja reciclando plásticos, nylon, papel y cartón. Ella trabaja como microempresaria con el apoyo de sus pequeñas hijas quienes le colaboran con este pesado trabajo, el cual es su fuente de ingreso con los que cubre la manutención de sus 4 hijos; vive en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la Zona Villa Ingenio de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito ira destinado a realizar su sueño mas añorado por Doryz de comprarse un terreno para su posterior construcción de casa propia. Es el cuarto crédito con IMRPO; los antecedentes anteriores le facultan para aprobarle la solicitud.

loans.use: to buy land

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for IMPRO - Oct 25, 2008)

loans.name: Leonor Mariza

texts.es:
Leonor works without rest , selling food at the events in her community. Because she does not have a secure kiosk or stand, she prepares her dishes in her home. Even with this hard reality she has been able to grow her business, motivated by the immense love she feels as a mother for her three young children. Thanks to her talent with food, many people enjoy her excellent cooking. However, because she does not have a fixed place for her business, she is limited in how much she can grow and earn. Her goal is to acquire her own kiosk from which to sell her dishes, allowing her to increase her income, better care for her children and cover their costs. With your support she will be able to realize her goals.

La señora Leonor, trabaja incansablemente vendiendo comida en los eventos de su comunidad de manera ambulante; debido a que no tiene un puesto o un lugar seguro donde ofertar sus riquísimos platillos, por ello los prepara en su hogar y aprovecha los eventos o reuniones. A pesar de esta dura realidad ha sabido salir adelante, motivada por el inmenso amor de madre que les ofrece a sus tres pequeños hijos. Gracias a su habilidad muchas personas disfrutan de su excelente sazón y gran versatilidad de platos; sin embargo el no tener un lugar idóneo para ofertar sus platillos la limita a aumentar sus ganancias y producción.Por lo que anhela grandemente adquirir su propio kiosco para vender sus riquísimos platillos, de tal manera que pueda seguir siendo aquél apoyo incondicional para sus hijos y así mismo seguir siendo el deleite de sus comensales.Con vuestra importante colaboración podrá convertir en realidad sus anhelos.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO BUY A KIOSK SO SHE CAN PREPARE AND SELL HER DELICIOUS DISHES

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel has shown great care and interest in his work of sowing and cultivating fruits since he was a boy. As a young man, he learned to perfect this ability, and with much effort, he became an excellent farmer and obtained the best products of his community. With this activity, he has been able to construct his house and has adquired some material goods, which he hopes to offer to his future family. Nevertheless, now at 28 years old, he continues striving for his future beloved wife and family. He plans to start growing coffee, which is currently having a huge boom in demand, to be able to settle his own expenses and to save what's necessary to be able to offer comfort and well-being to his future family. He is counting on your enormous generosity to be able to carry out his plans.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Daniel, mostró siempre desde niño un gran cariño e interés en las labores de siembra y cultivo de frutas, ya de joven aprendió a perfeccionar esta capacidad y con mucho esfuerzo llegó a convertirse en un excelente agricultor y a obtener los mejores productos de su comunidad.Con esta actividad ha podido construir su casita y ha adquirido algunos bienes materiales los cuales desea ofrecer a su futura familia, sin embargo ahora a sus 28 años, continúa esforzándose por su futura amada esposa y familia Por lo que ha pensado incursionar en el cultivo de café, que está teniendo un gran auge y demanda en la actualidad para poder solventar los gastos de sí mismo y ahorrar lo necesario para ofrecerle comodidad y bienestar a su futura familia.Cuenta con vuestra enorme generosidad para llevar a cabo sus planes.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds to grow coffee on his fruitful lands

loans.name: Gisela Edith

texts.es:
Gisela has shown a great interest in cooking since she was a little girl. Thanks to the knowledge imparted in her by her mother, she has been able to perfect this talent with time and has been able to contribute economically to her family. She diligently attends her clients and offers them a variety of dishes daily. She also dedicates herself to the production of plantains on her small farm, hard work which has let her open a store to increase her income even more. She lives in the native community of Mariscal Cáceres in Perene and her wish is to be able to liven up her store properly and to air-condition her food locale to be able to attend her clients efficiently. For this wish, she needs your help. Please contribute to helping Gisela better her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Gisela, desde niña siempre mostró un gran interés por la cocina, es así que gracias a los conocimientos impartidos por su madre, ha podido perfeccionar este talento con el tiempo y de esta manera ahora puede contribuir económicamente con su familia.Ella atiende diligentemente a sus clientes y les ofrece diversidad de platos diariamente; así mismo se dedica a la producción de plátanos en su pequeña chacra, trabajo arduo que le ha permitido abrir una tienda para incrementar aún más sus ingresos. Ella vive en una comunidad nativa de Mariscal Cáceres en Perene y su deseo es lograr ambientar su tienda debidamente y acondicionar su local de comida para atender a sus clientes eficientemente; para este anhelo necesita la ayuda de vosotros.Contribuya con la superación de Gisela

loans.use: To strengthen the small businesses that she owns.

loans.name: Richard Dante

texts.es:
Richard learned the value of work when he was young. Today we find him hard at work at his small farm, cultivating fruit. He explains to us that he is also a trucker which makes it hard for him to take care of his small shop. This shop is the result of a great effort and provides him with his main source of income. For this reason he very much wants to expand and offer a larger quantity of products, so that he cn provide a better life for his two small children. At 30 years old, this self sacrificing father needs our support. Let's contribute to his efforts so he can realize his goals and help his family.

Richard, aprendió el valor del trabajo desde pequeño ya que empezó a laborar a temprana edad. Lo encontramos trabajando arduamente en su chacra en la producción de frutas, nos contó que también es transportista y así mismo se iba presuroso a atender su pequeña bodega.Esa bodega es el fruto del gran trabajo que él desarrolla y es quizás su fuente principal de ingreso, por lo que nos contó que deseaba mucho mejorarla y contar con una mayor cantidad de productos, por lo que su meta es brindarles lo mejor a sus dos pequeños hijos.A sus 30 años este abnegado padre de familia desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia a través de su esfuerzo, pero para ello también necesita del apoyo de vosotros.Contribuyamos con esta noble persona para que haga realidad sus deseos

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN HIS BUSINESS, EXPAND THE PRODUCTS HE OFFERS AND PROVIDE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR HIS FAMILY.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor gets up very early every day to work diligently picking bananas and pineapples. She learned how to do this work when she was veyr young, and she takes care in how she handles the fruit. All of these efforts have allowed her to open a small shop in her home, where she provides various products to the people in her community. Flor has two children, 5 and 6 years old. They are her source of motivation to continue working so hard. One of her children suffers from serious bronchitis and needed to be hospitalized. This results in an enormous cost for the family. Because of this, and to prevent more difficulty in the future, she wants to invest in her business and sell a great quantity of products so she can continue supporting her family. Please help this hardworking woman so she can continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

Flor, se levanta todos los días muy temprano para internarse diligentemente en la producción de plátanos y piñas, hábilmente cuida de cada fruto ya que ella aprendió esta actividad desde muy niña.Todo este esfuerzo le permitió abrir una tienda en su casa donde expende múltiples productos a los pobladores de su comunidad. Ella tiene dos hijos de 5 y 6 años que son su fuente de motivación para seguir luchando, sin embargo uno de ellos sufrió una fuerte bronquitis por lo que tuvo que ser internado en el hospital de Santa Ana.Aquello significó un enorme gasto para la familia y ante este hecho y para prevenir otros, desea reinvertir en su bodega y así lograr comercializar una mayor cantidad de productos, de manera que pueda seguir apoyando a su familia con esta actividad. Apoyemos a esta noble mujer para que siga incrementando la calidad de vida de su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN THE SMALL GENERAL STORE SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME, EXPAND THE PRODUCTS SHE CAN SELL AND INCREASE HER INCOME.  SHE NEEDS TO COVER MEDICAL COSTS FOR ONE OF HER SONS, AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FOR THE FAMILY.

loans.name: William Ernesto

texts.es:
In the heat of the jungle, the most used transportation vehicles are motorcycles. Ernesto is a skilled driver of these vehicles. He learned this work when he was a young man, and today it is his principal source of income. Ernesto has four young children, whom he supports by sending them money since he is separated from his wife, who lives with his children. Many times not having them by his side fills him with sadness, but he puts forth an immense effort to send them what they need for their development. His wish is to contribute properly to his children, and this is why he wants to buy an additional vehicle so that he can increase his income and accomplish his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

En el calor de la selva, los vehículos de transporte más usados son los motocars y Ernesto es un hábil conductor de estos vehículos, él aprendió a trabajar así, desde joven y hoy en día es su principal fuente de trabajo.Ernesto tiene cuatro hijos menores, a los cuales mantiene enviándoles dinero, ya que es separado de su esposa, quién ahora vive con sus hijos. Muchas veces el no poderlos tener a su lado lo llena de tristeza, sin embargo se esfuerza inmensamente para enviarles lo necesario, para su desarrollo.Su deseo es contribuir debidamente con sus hijos y es por ello que desea comprarse un vehículo adicional, para que pueda incrementar sus ingresos y pueda lograr sus metas.

loans.use: Purchase of an additional vehicle to increase his income and the quality of life of his beloved children.

loans.name: Verónica Violeta

texts.es:
